7zjb40HODD7XoW8Fd5NOOA.text: We had a fantastic time celebrating a birthday dinner at Eddie V's last night. We had the private room for our large party and Corbin and Justin were absolutely fantastic servers! They were charming, attentive, funny, and overall just great servers. We could not have asked for a better experience. The food was also wonderful. I would highly recommend the scallops, the gratin potatoes, and the sea bass. Thank you Eddie V's, for making this dinner a remarkable experience for all!

JX76hQxpYfAODKmCMB61nw.text: Went for a early Father's Day Thursday night and had a great time. David our server was very diligent and personable making the experience that much better. Yellow tail sashimi and halibut was Excellent as well as the assortment of oysters. Atmosphere was high end and perfect for a martini. I'll definitely be back.

MsRuaYM2CCy2yTfpvQA4pA.text: After visiting Eddie V's for the first time last night, Eddie V's should receive a Michelin Star for their outstanding staff and quality of food served in the restaurant but most especially at the bar. Phenomenal cocktail engineer, Mariah, took special care for not only my girlfriend and I, but also about 40 other guests at the same time. She made what looks to be a very stressful environment, into a beautiful dance highlighted by the amazing live jazz band playing in the background. The entire staff were the most kind, gracious, friendly and helpful people I have experienced in a Charlotte restaurant. From the hostess walking me to the restroom instead of giving general directions, to the server asking how my day has been (while holding a full tray of food) this first time experience was the BEST dining experience I've had this year! We will be regulars at Eddie V's, every Tuesdays!

kwPT1kxH0OFWxO5CSgEmoA.text: We went to Eddie V's expecting it to be as good or better than its' sister The Capital Grill. It turned out to be the worst evening we had ever had at a restaurant, any restaurant.  The service was atrociously slow, and the food mediocre at best.  Our server, who knew we were celebrating anniversaries, couldn't have cared less.  I would not send my worst enemy to Eddie V's.  At their prices, good luck to them surviving.

UnGPzEuvcGsE8wC03KS1zA.text: Eddie V's was phenomenal from beginning to end. I was first impressed with the high tech (cell phone based system) valet parking. Once you step in the ambiance was exquisite and picture perfect. Although, you'll need some additional lighting for selfies b/c it's a bit dark. My group of servers (team model) were very attentive and thoughtful. They offered great pairing recommendations. I had the crab cake appetizer and the Ribeye with the crab stuffed shrimp accompaniment. My friend had the lobster tacos and sea bass (which I sampled). The sides come a la carte so one of our servers recommended doing 2 smaller portioned sides. So we opted for the crab fried rice and au gratin cheddar potatoes. Everything (minus the shrimp) was superb! I'm a lover of crab stuffed shrimp and theirs was okay. Theirs came with plenty of crab, still I've had better. I paired my meal with a nice Malbec. I highly recommend Eddie V's and will definitely go back. Their happy hour menu is next on my list.

ZXHAulwUQ5s7LTbCkvMnpw.text: Though i have received better service, I'm still going to give this place 5 stars....This place is aesthetically pleasing, there's a lot of detail and thought that went behind the decor to create a nice ambiance. The live jazz is a nice touch that adds to whole feel and experience.  The food was great from the organic greens, to the steak and truffle mashed potatoes to finally my dessert which was banana foster cake. I would definitely recommend. I got the 22 Oz rib eye bone in, and it was the best steak I've ever had.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States

PzeMBZ8035Ksux8dSiPx5g.text: My rating is exclusively based on price - and what my expectations are for when you get into the $100-$150 per person category of restaurants. For the price; you have dozens of other options in Charlotte. The wine list and venue are great. Wait staff are in white jackets and there was live music both times we visited. The first occasion was shortly after opening and we credited their issues to being new - but for a $55 crab-topped steak, you shouldn't be picking out shells. The second time was a bit worse with food coming out of the kitchen very inconsistently, 3 of our 5 guests had to wait an additional 15 minutes for the food to come out after the other 2 entrees were served. Personally did not like the lobster mashed potatoes - whereas I'll go out of my way to Del Frisco's lobster mac and cheese which is executed better.  Again, at this price point, you can go to Ruth's Chris or Capital Grille and get a more consistent and exceptional experience.

WJYXbzne8s8JphiVTdxpyw.text: We had the best dinner here tonight. Starting with cocktails at the bar to the seafood tower which blew our socks off to an incredible set of entrees and delicious desert it was the BEST MEAL we've had in Charlotte. Our server assistant, Tyler, made the experience. He was friendly, attentive, considerate, and all around one of the best waiters we've had. He truly made the evening incredible. Our bartender, Mallory, made the best martini I've had in Charlotte as well. Everything about the restaurant was incredible. The food was incredible and the wine selection sealed the deal. We could not have imagined a better evening on the town and I will recommend this restaurant to anyone. Thank you for an incredible evening and a huge thank you to Mallory, Tyler, and Bren (the manager) who took extra special care of us this evening. I look forward to coming back again soon.

GVEpM3N-0IgyUrrfiZ6f5Q.text: My husband and I went here on 5/13. The service, food, music and decor were great! The servers were well dressed paid great attention to detail. It was my birthday and they gave me a rose and a birthday card. I decided to try the swordfish steak, it was prepared perfectly, great flavor! My husband had the salmon oscar style, we chose sauteed spinach which was incredible and bursting with flavor we also chose the lobster mac and cheese GREAT! The music smooth jazz live band live singer, not to cheesy or uptight and most importantly not to loud! The decor was nice with a romantic feel. I would recommend this place for date night, girls night out, private events as they have a private room! The drinks were great I tried the 25 Karate drink, awesomeness! The wine selection was great much to choose from! I would not recommend this place for kids or those who are looking to do anything other than relax.

lN3Yl4V7S0Qol4tu1vDuzw.text: I can't wait to go back to this restaurant. My friends and I had a taste for some non-fried seafood so we visited Eddie V's for the first time. We were greeted by a wonderful young lady with a welcoming smile and upbeat attitude. The hostess who seated us was also very pleasant and obliged us when we asked to be seated at a table not so close to the great jazz trio playing that evening. Our waitress Gem was the best! We all ordered the lobster tacos and share the asparagus, lobster mashed potatoes, and mac and cheese. EVERYTHING was tasty and the overall service was exceptional.

yC8MK6dfOnmBlI2yZygJeA.text: Great food, but it was my birthday and they had me sitting by the bar with a loud band. I couldn't hear my friends and we couldn't talk because no one could hear. We asked to be moved, but they were unable to do so even though there were many open tables in the next room. For the amount we all spent, it was disappointing the service. I will make sure I ask if they have a band next time I decide to come to see if I will go elsewhere.

z0Bh3izHFjKm9AOpI98l7Q.text: Went here for my birthday and had a great experience! It was very crowded but we were seated right away. (reservations are a must). The drinks made perfectly, the food even better. Out of the 4 of us (which we can be picky foodies at times) not one complaint. I come from the restaurant industry with over 20 yrs in the business from the front of the house to the back of the house to General Manager and I have to say, this place left no stone unturned and the attention to detail was bar none. I definitely recommend this place. a bit on the pricey side but well worth it!

OPr__igBokMNKuu-IX5L4w.text: Just wanted to truly thank Niko, Kat, Patrick and Brynn for each spending time with me tonight. P]  Had one of the best meal experiences I've had in a long long time. I travel for my job and all the staff at the Ritz highly recommended me visiting this new establishment.  I already thanked all of them for the fantastic recommendation.   The food was superb but more importantly to me was the staff. Very attentive to all details. They must go through some rigorous bootcamp process because each and everyone I encountered was customer focused and enjoyed their being there as much as I did.   Sorry if I forgot to mention anyone but I without question give them 10 stars.  Yes I realize it only goes up to 5!!!  Enjoy!!!!

qVBTUziiOrbnDBEoE7ICAw.text: First time eating at Eddie V's last night and was thoroughly impressed! Our waiter was great, service amazing, food was to die for!!! Lobster tacos, wedge salad, Oscar style filet and my favorite.....truffle Mac and cheese  I will definitely be going back!

lb7F1OiI2jkHFGqoFsIfmQ.text: Nick was our waiter on a special night and we couldn't have asked for a more charming and competent host. He walked me down the stairs arm in arm to show me to the ladies room in style and ballroom grace. You the quality of the fare was only surpassed by nicks charm and highly competent service. Brynn, made a memorable night even more enjoyable with her personal attention as manager of this establishment. Eddie V's is definitely our first choice for our next special occasion. Thank you all.

HTF1tndvi3Y4zfjKl2tzBA.text: The restaurant is pretty and the service is stellar. We ordered the lobster Bisque. It was good....once we added more pepper. I ordered Salmon and my husband got Butterfish. They were both good but not amazing. We got the Godiva Chocolate Molten cake which tasted like any Molten Chocolate cake. All the food is good and prepared well but none of it was special.

FBVgG6o5JQhbVzEcFVGNlw.text: My husband and I went to Charlotte Eddie V's for the first time on Thursday.  Several of our friends went during the first week and said they had a terrible dining experience.  We thought we would wait and hopefully they would work out the kinks.  Nope.  We had a horrible experience.  Waited far too long for our cocktails.  Far too long for our appetizers and far too long for our entrees.  Forgot our sides as well.  How does THAT happen??!! We had the Osetra caviar and oysters for appetizers.  Couldn't really mess that up.  Entrees were just ok.  Can get a better steak elsewhere.  King crab was not great.  Service was disorganized.  You would think that since this is a chain, they would have a great training program.  We sat at the bar, like many friends suggested because they had bad dining room service.  No excuses about sitting at the bar to dine.  We sit at the bar at The Palm and Capitol Grille all the time.  No issues.  The poor man next to us was trying to get one of the 3 bartenders to look his way so he could pay his bill!  He waited over 10 minutes!  There was no way they didn't notice him waving his hands.  When we finally were acknowledged, I pointed out the man next to us trying to pay his tab.  Also, I ordered the duet champagne.  Poured my second champagne (different champagne) in the same glass and I still had champagne in it.   My husband waited almost 15 minutes for his bottle of wine.  Apparently, there was some confusion about where the bottle was....???! The bar had 4 empty seats.  So not super busy. We soooo wanted to love this new restaurant, but it was not at all a great experience.   Nothing stood out.  It's cool looking and nice to go somewhere with live music, but that's the only positive that we took away from our experience.  Except, we did make a friend while sitting at the bar because she was complaining too.  Not kidding.   We probably won't be back.  We have our tried and True restaurants.  This place was just a confusing hassle.  Really too bad.

zoTISpA_Yw2q0x5RmIA1mA.text: So this is my first review and I'm pretty excited to type it! This was my first time here and I loved how everyone greeted me. "Hello", "Good evening", "How are you", etc. My party and I were seated and our server Shane was amazing. Very friendly. Easy to converse with. Very knowledgeable about the food. Assisted with everything! The experience is just so phenomenal. The food itself is stellar. I had the 22oz Ribeye while my party and I also shared the crab fried rice, asparagus, and truffle mac and cheese. Wow is all I can say. Presentation, taste, how it was served, was just so captivating. It doesn't stop there! I had the bananas foster for dessert. I really don't eat desserts, because I don't really have a sweet tooth. However, this was one of the best desserts I ever had! It was sweet, salty, savory, everything I would want quite honestly. At the end of the night, I didn't realize that I left my car keys on the table. The server assistant Micheal, who was also very pleasant and polite-actually ran down the street to hand me my keys which I greatly appreciate. Definitely going here again. I highly recommend this place if you want an all around fulfilling experience. Thank you, Eddie V's.

REl0Gb1yVM0_dpEP0L0EZA.text: Amazing new addition to Charlotte! I recently celebrated my birthday there and they did a phenomenal job! I was so impressed by the spectacular customer service! We opted for the happy hour and everything was delicious - highly recommend the fish tacos and salt/pepper shrimp. It was definitely a birthday to remember and can't wait to come back!

K_-4ODf_k_LFjmECPtnQPg.text: The Parmesan Sole was incredible and their sides have to be the best (and largest) I've had at any restaurant!! The Lobster Mac N Cheese had large portions of lobster. Truly a great seafood restaurant!!

IuQ5-peJyfQ9amqlQ4QQrQ.text: Eddie V's is a fancy seafood restaurant. Staff are friendly but slightly uppity. It's a good birthday, date night, or special occasion restaurant but a little overpriced for just grabbing dinner. Because service is a bit slower they are often packed, try sitting at the bar! There are better seafood places in Charlotte if that's all your after; check out Fin & Fino or Sea Level

bi14D4BvLeHJipJ215yTRw.text: This was our first trip to Eddie V and probably our last, we started off on the wrong foot we ordered Martini's and asked for blue cheese olives which is a must for me! The waitress came back and said they were still making them, it was 5:30 on Saturday night so I let it go was told she would bring them we ordered the Crab Cake and the East Coast oysters both was great! But that was it we ordered off the Restaurant week  menu but both dinners we did the upgrade definitely not worth it the filet with shrimp scampi and asparagus with Bearnaise sauce. Well it was 2 end pieces of. Filet and 3 shrimp no scampi sauce at all! My husband had the 22 oz steak again no  Aujus sauce for the steak and the mash potatoes were not presentable. I guess when you go to restaurant and except so much and your just let down and still spend $240 it just does not seem right

ePav8mXBv4nwfVxTZjBRaw.text: My wife and I ate at this restaurant last night before Hamilton. As for the food, it is pretty typical for "high end" Charlotte fish and steak places. Food is a little worse than Upstream, ambiance is a little better. Food is a little better than DelFrisco's, ambiance is a little worse. Service is slow, staff not knowledgeable about the wine, our order was a little wrong but they fixed it.   However, today I received an alert from my credit card that they overcharged me $129 above what I authorized on my credit card. I never recommend or eat at restaurants that try to rip me off, and I don't think you should eat at a place that would let this happen either. Although I have tried to get someone on the phone to correct it, and have sent emails to the restaurant, the problem has not been addressed at all. I will not be back. Overcharging by that much cannot be an accident.

HGRA8blI9zNNrpuVHqpVrw.text: This was my first experience at Eddie V's. My friend and I walked in and felt to welcomed. We have a reservation but we early so we had a drink at the bar. The drinks were perfect and bartenders were so friendly and knowledgeable. From the moment we were seated we were treated like royalty. Everyone from the hostess, bartender, waiter and food runners were super friendly and top notch. The truffle mac n cheese is a definite must have. We ordered as side to share. The best decision ever besides dining here.

Xo3pjuFgWHQrVsYZ-zeTeA.text: The staff was really kind. The venue was pretty and I enjoyed the live music. Valet/reception/our server/ and management were courteous and helpful. Service was also very fast and professional.   The food was prepared well with the exception of the crab fried rice. It arrived to the table very cold and there were bits of shell in my crab taco but not much. Also the noodles in the truffle Mac and cheese were a little firm.  The sole was cooked perfectly as was the lump crab cake and the lobster mashed potatoes.   My biggest concern was with the 91 sanitation score. I noticed the score as i was leaving. I typically won't eat anywhere under a 96. Really curious to learn what violations the restaurant had to cause such a low score.

xQEkY1Ky4oVJSJ2EfCJmBw.text: I went to this place because a good friend that travels to Charlotte with some frequency highly recommended it.   As a frequent visitor to Mastro's Ocean Club, I thought Eddie's was very similar to Mastro's in terms of the menu options and service provided. But the pricing is a little easier on the wallet.  I got their Norwegian Salmon and my husband got the Bacon Wrapped Filets "Oscar" Style. Both were quite delicious, had a great flavor pairings, and went well with the side of Truffle Macaroni and Cheese. Both of us thought the the Mac and cheese was similar to our favorite Mastro's side, their black truffle gnocchi.   For dessert we had the Banana Foster Butter Cake. Now since my husband and I are HUGE Mastro butter cake fans, I was thoroughly blown away by how close in texture and flavor Eddie V's cake was to their's. The banana foster topping was a perfect compliment to the buttery rich goodness of the warm cake and the pecan ice cream. And how can you not like something served a flambe!   All of that to say, if you are a familiar with Mastro's you'll feel right at home at Eddie V's.

sdqK-PGDORfQZMxTEsPFxA.text: Wonderful and attentive service from start to finish. Nice atmosphere. I had the seabass which was delicious and my husband had a steak which he really enjoyed. The drinks were yummy as well. However, the standout was the bananas foster- hands down one of the best desserts I have ever tasted!!! Worth the trip on its own.

XogSbmOgqdJLJrlVJMLp5g.text: The service, the food, the drinks, and dessert; everything about this place is amazing. The atmosphere is beautiful. This was the best fine dining experience I've ever had. Our server David was very knowledgeable about the menu and very helpful. I will definitely be returning.

iuE_rXWy5m8K__1PKWA7Tw.text: My fiance and I went during restaurant week. It was also his birthday.  We stopped at the bar before dinner to enjoy some oysters and live jazz. The oysters were awesome. My vodka gimlet was unbalanced and was too heavy on the lime. The volume on the live music was good, audible but not overpowering conversation.   When we were seated we had a little extra decoration for the special occasion.   Our waiter was friendly and informative. In general service was good.  I had the ceasar salad to start. It was well plated and tasted good. My fiance had the chowder which was delightfully rich with a nice hint of smoke.  My fiance got bacon wrapped filet oscar with king crab and asparagus with bearnaise. I ordered the swordfish cooked in olive oil with asparagus seasoned with lemon and salt. We added on a side of crab fried rice. The fried rice is without exception the best fried rice I have ever had. My swordfish was over and a little dry. The asparagus was grilled and pretty great. The bacon wrapped filet was a rare case of being a good bacon wrapped dish. The bacon added a nice smokey component to the filet.  For dessert I had "Bananas Foster" butter cake. My fiance had butterscotch pana cotta.  The bananas foster was exceptional. I skipped the pana cotta because I don't like butterscotch.   All in all, definitely worth a visit.

EOw4IFx0mqgTGuHWQnyEiw.text: Delicious food! It was our anniversary and the restaurant surprised us with a rose and free dessert. I was not the biggest fan of their wine list, but we did find a bottle of sparkling that we enjoyed. The food here is pricey, but it's a good value.

PIv0pkUQwoDXbHHc8UtLEw.text: The food was fantastic. The server had the best personality, but his support was awful. The table received and ate their dinner before mine finally came. They tried to offer a free desert to make up for it but then that took almost 25 minutes to arrive.

tpfVAzGhV-EplbFxH51kPg.text: Went for my Anniversary Dinner.  This place is amazing   Just happen to learn Eddie V was here by driving by.  We dined at the one in Tampa Fl  but this location is on another level.  Food was good. Drinks was great and the Ambiance was superb.  Pricy but worth it.

QF76Pmpi8Q_oIvA3FZJeEA.text: Service, flavor and atmosphere were impeccable. Stopped by Eddie V's for happy hour before attending a show in Uptown. Meredith took great care of us. The entire staff was very friendly and welcoming.   I had the crab cake which was more crab than cake. It was really good. I was impressed by the over abundance of crab in the dish. It was not all filler with little crab like other restaurants serve.   I will definitely be back repeatedly.

HC66LfgcDCRXFPqTEuNGcA.text: Impressed is not even the word. We came here to celebrate my birthday and as excited as I already was to simply try this place out we found out upon arrival that it was also the week of Queens Feast! The ambiance is to die for! It is very intimate and the live music is my favorite piece to it. They walked us to our table where there was table confetti and a birthday card already propped up just for me. We ordered a bottle of Pinot Grigio and were satisfied with what the queens feast menu had to offer. I started with the Caesar salad and moved to the swordfish with asparagus as a side and ended with the bananas foster because it was highly recommended. The staff really knows how to make their guests feel special as we had multiple visits to the table wishing me a happy birthday and making sure I was accommodated. He swordfish was very thick and amazing. It was filled with flavor and reminded me almost of a juicy steak. The only thing I would say that turned me off from this experience would be dessert. The Bacardi infused bananas foster had amazing presentation as they light it on fire in front of your face, but once the flame is gone and you taste it you may as well be scooping up moonshine to wash down all of the great tasting food away. It was very disappointing. I will try not to let this take away from my experience but it was definitely big enough to knock off one star from this place.

svm-BJ5AmHUzZL4ENOvTUQ.text: I only went for cocktails on a Saturday evening. They had live music... unfortunately the jazz band they had there kept me from giving this place 5 stars. I love jazz, both old school and new age, but that was the sleepiest jazz I've ever heard in my life. Listening to them was like watching paint dry. The establishment itself is beautiful, my bartenders were professional and attentive, and their customer drinks were nice. Crowd was a mixed bag as there were some pretty uppity and pretentious people there, but also a mix of more down to earth people who made for some great convos around the bar. Next time I'll be sure to go when a different band is playing so I can have a chance of staying awake.

XG0ZFHbXQWX_d24tq6In-w.text: It's our second time coming.... Menu is excellent, service is phenomenal, atmosphere is incredible, and the drinks are top notch.  In our 2 visits We've ordered the stuffed shrimp, calamari, lobster bisque, filet, lobster tails and red snapper... all have been delicious!  They weren't on their A game tonight, but I still give them 5 stars.  Wonderful restaurant

WdhG-5u0t0cZVh2k3oZFbg.text: 1st visit to Eddie V's, and it's their 1st participation in Charlotte Restaurant Week. I am a fair patron, I don't expect things to be perfect during madness. Some people say "don't go during Restaurant Week" but honestly I think this is the best time to see if a restaurant can be grace under fire. It also can showcase the level of service the place has to offer. And unfortunately for Eddie V's, it failed, in a big fat F sort of way.   Reservation for 5 at 7:45pm. We arrived on time. We know we wouldn't get a table at 7:45pm. For restaurant week, 30 minutes swing is reasonable and tolerable. But they offer no system (via cell, or buzzer, or anything) to receive updates. They sure did not go to the bar area to update us when the wait is exceeding 30 minutes. I shouldn't have to keep going back & forth asking for news because I wasn't at an IHOP. Fail #1 - poor communications with customers.   There were some high tops in the bar opening up, one would have sat 5. But did they offer it to us who have been patiently waiting and dying from hunger? No. They gave it to 2 people who I am sure came in after us. Fail #2 - poor table assignment management - at least gave us an option to sit at the bar when available.   Eventually after an hour plus, we were given a table. To be transparent, I was told the reason our table took so long was that the previous party had been occupying it since 5pm and just hanging out. Those people should be ashamed of themselves. Nonetheless the hostess lady told me that they would comp a round of drinks and denoted on the table notes. Waiter David never acknowledged our wait, or said anything about comping 1 round of drinks. Fail #3 - I should not have to tell the waiter how long we just waited and the fact that we were told a round of drinks is on the house (because someone should have whispered in his ears already even if he didn't see the notes).  We waited quite a while to receive our drinks. Long enough that my friend's old fashioned was looking a little light colored (from melted ice). We placed our food order. They ran out of crab & corn chowder, but luckily they had alternative soup offerings. Then eventually our entrees arrived. 4 out of 5 entrees arrived. No one acknowledged that we're missing a dish. We thought maybe it's just right behind the rest of us. But nothing, nada. We felt bad but we started to eat or our food would be cold. Eventually the 5th entree showed up, no mentioning as to how or why or the fact it went missing to start with. And it was way undercooked. So poor other friend of mine ate around the filet because he ordered medium (yes, medium, but that's a different topic) and it came out almost rare. And no one really checked with us after his entree was delivered. Fail # 4 - poor timing of food delivery and follow up.  Then David disappeared. Like we didn't even see him walking around in the dining room sort of disappeared. We are now 3 hours after our initial reservation, 45 minutes after the official closing time of the restaurant, empty tabled waiting for 3rd course. And we have not seen one manager walking by. It's like, let's pretend we didn't have service issues. We finally received our dessert AFTER I made a quick stop to the front hostess stand to inform the hostess that our waiter went MIA. Truth is that's when I found out our waiter's name because there wasn't much of an intro. Fail #5 - services got worse along the way, zero acknowledgement from anyone, including management.  Luckily the company was delightful and patient enough to wait out a 4 hour dinner. Food was great overall. My steak was cooked & seasoned perfectly. Lobster bisque was tasty (no actual lobster meat however). Panna cotta and butter cake were excellent. The catch of the day was cooked perfectly but lack seasoning/taste. But food itself can't make a high-end restaurant. And a high-end restaurant has to shine even when dealing with "us poor folks" that dine during Restaurant Week.  Again, I know this is Restaurant Week, and I know this is their 1st go-round, but they are owned by the same group that owns The Capital Grille. Last I checked CG was still excellent with dealing with the madness and offered excellent services. So do they not train the new spot with some talents from down the road? Because they should.   3-star is being nice, giving them a benefit of the doubt, considering the food quality and that everyone was friendly enough and no one was rude.

TdfoBzVy_UEf-97Bo1-K3g.text: Really incredibly disappointed by the service provided during restaurant week. We had a large party reserved months ago to celebrate multiple birthday's. After waiting for over an hour for our table to be ready (which we were all understanding of and didn't even complain,) we were seated. Given all regular menu's so 30 minutes later when we were still waiting on Restaurant Week menus and asked about it wondering why 30 min later we still hadn't received those menus, a server pouring waters then barks back "I don't know what you expect for service. You get restaurant week $35 service" and kept ranting. I asked him to please leave, (he needed to cool off and really offended and angered me before it escalated) and he continued to go off. As we argued, because I refused to have someone continue talking to me like that, I asked for a manager. When she came in, she promptly walked to the head of the table and apologized to everyone for everything taking so long when I explained to her, it wasn't even that everything was taking so long, but it's the way we're being spoken to and reiterated what the server had been saying. To which he raised his voice and began arguing and one of the members of our party had to even get up and get in between him and our table to get him to calm down. He was angry I called him out to his manager right in front of him, but the way the manager approached it, I had no choice. This is an EMPLOYEE of the restaurant behaving this way and having to be blocked from our table and yelling at us by another member of the party!  The manager never removed him from our party the whole night and never said anything else about it. I would understand if we were a rambunctious party causing trouble, but that was not the case at all. I am honestly still just appalled as I sit here and write this and replay the whole scenario. I have never in my life gone to a restaurant, whether during a regular time or during Restaurant Week and been treated like this and management never batting an eye to improve the situation. Or be degraded for being a "$35 Restaurant Week customer" who shouldn't expect great service.   I truly don't believe Eddie V's is prepared to take part in something like Charlotte Restaurant Week and they completely ruined our birthday celebration as that behavior and attitude set the mood for the entire evening. The only words to describe our experience is disappointed and insulted.

xyWUvB9vjeHmdLYzOsl4MQ.text: Well, my wife and I are in Charlotte for a family visit. And looking for a place to eat while in town we came across Eddie V's .....during restaurant week no less. Not expecting much because we're snobs from NYC, When there was no salt and pepper shakers on the table we   was hoping for a pleasant surprise. My prayers were answered. Mary had the sea bass and I the Rib Eye. Both entrees were simply the best and the desserts were a home run. Big shout out to our server, Erin. She was supurb and the Managing Partner, Aimee has her crew working on all cylinders. Bravo!

6uXMZj_n9Wh_KpcDuMFBjg.text: The Georges Bank Scallops  are life changing. They are perfectly seared and paired with grapefruit and brown butter sauce. It makes for a light refreshing flavor but each element adds a nice texture. I could've ordered 3 more servings. The Chilean Sea Bass is steamed Hong King styled then settled in a light soy broth. Our dessert the banana foster was equally amazing and definitely had a wow factor to it since they pour all liquid on it and light it for you. So if you're a seafood lover and looking for a great date night you should definitely stop in. I highly recommend making a reservation as they stay pretty booked. It's a bit pricey but was well worth it.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States

QKg8yETkvsboVoKbsmt1cw.text: Yum yum yum! Everything I ate was great.  From the lobster bisque to the salmon. Ambience was beautiful and atmosphere was amazing. People were beautiful and the wait staff was very professional and catering.

xDWWMpCdczkYbaMO_Usy4A.text: This location just recently opened in the Uptown area of Charlotte and all I can say is OMG. Our entire experience was amazing. The beverages I tried were the dirty martini and the peach mule. Both were great! I had the scallops (seared perfectly) and a couple of other people had the bone in ribeye and they LOVED it. My favorite side was the lobster mashed potatoes. Thick chunks of lobster meat all throughout the dish. Our server was so pleasant as well! Also, some nights during the summer, they have live entertainment on the main level. The ambiance was absolutely perfect. It's worth every single penny you pay for the experience.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States

qhL9zNPkCetzhwTiX0LfdQ.text: We frequent this establishment and normally absolutely love it. I took my sister here for her birthday and the experience was subpar to be polite. We ordered steaks that were medium plus and we got rare. They took both steaks back and returned about ten minutes later with medium rare steaks. We had another guest who joined us and her steak was cooked to her liking, however, she never got to eat it because the girl in the lounge never brought her bernaise sauce so her steak was COLD by the time she finally got her sauce from a manager. All this to say, they only comped a dessert for a birthday. We still paid for the steaks that were not to our standards. Hopefully it was a bad night for them but I can say that the male manager(with dark hair) mocked our guest as we were paying our bill.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. When they brought it back to me. Does this look like medium plus?!
Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. Upon arrival

74oBU-1biR-Pm-4aKYu7rA.text: My wife and I just ate here and we cannot recommend it more highly! The menu offered about 15 items we wanted to try, so we know we're coming back. The lobster bisque presentation was only surpassed by the exquisite taste. The salmon, steak, scallops, and crab fried rice were all unbelievably awesome. Also, the server we had -Aaron- was the best server we've ever had. Anywhere. I know how that sounds. But it's True.  It was a wonderful experience!

593BQED72BMEvBNLG07rAg.text: ORDER THE TRUFFLE MAC AND CHEESE is all you need to know. I'm kidding...but not really. The opening of Eddie V's Uptown was definitely worth the wait. Overall, the atmosphere is awesome...live music every night in the bar and great service. Try the lobster tacos as an appetizer...so delicious. We also loved the calamari. All of the food is very rich (a bit difficult to eat "clean" here), but absolutely worth the calories. Solid happy hour as well with some good deals, but definitely get there early to ensure you can snag a seat in the bar area.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. Crab legs
Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. Entrance from Tryon St.

jiw6R_CP5Pov5sUPNUbdeg.text: The food was amazing but service was mediocre. We sat down around 830 and didn't leave until they closed at 11. Our waitress was nice but I feel like my table was an afterthought. At one point the manager came over and said our food was taking so long because we ordered a 22 oz steak. My boyfriend was visibly upset and she said well it's only been 30 minutes. She knew we were waiting too long because she didn't say anything to any other tables. I feel her comment was unnecessary and borderline unprofessional. Our order may have been ENTERED 30 minutes prior in their system but we were waiting much longer. There wasn't a seamless transition between entrees  and I was expecting that at a restaurant of this caliber. Also our waitress wasn't necessary- the runners brought our food and retrieved her for drinks.   It took 20+ minutes for my first drink. I wanted to order another but said forget it when she was mia. I noticed tables around us came in after and left before us. Their waiters also had more of an interaction with the patrons. Maybe this was a bad night so I won't completely write them off but I was beyond pissed off with our service last night.

zVcqTAFfJNaYYWoh5_ax0w.text: We came with a group to Eddie V's for New Year's Eve and it was wonderful. The atmosphere and service was top notch and the food was incredible.  People in our group got both steak and seafood, and everything was great. Like most fancy restaurants, the meal takes awhile since it is quite the experience, so make sure to plan accordingly if you have plans after dinner. I would highly recommend Eddie V's for any special occasion!

w1dTAbedRwlVlmaapPxL3Q.text: Same great ambiance and taste I grew to love in TysonsCorner! Extremely excited about the Charlotte location.   I ordered the crab bisque, crab stuffed shrimp and banana foster cake. The bisque was flavorful, rich and meaty. I spritzed s bit of lemon juice on the shrimp..my taste buds did a dance! Lastly, the bananas foster was decadent, buttery, crisp edges and it wasn't overtly sweet. Wonderful meal worth every cent!   This visit was made during happy hour. I noticed there were only older couples- no singles. Hopefully, a happy hours crowd of 30 plus age group begin to come out.  ** Ladies, please be aware the bathroom lighting is quite dim. Definitely not the place to adjust makeup. Please ensure you're perfect before leaving home!  I attached a bathroom selfie so you can get an idea..

-aj8Y8KNR7peHTD_OyMajA.text: Made reservations at Eddie V's for on a Saturday night to celebrate Father's day. Took a good 10 min after our reservation to actually be seated and they seated us at the wrong table ( I guess there was a mix up in parties). The food was great, I highly recommend the parmesan crusted sole and lobster mashed potatoes. But in regards to the quality of fine dining and prices you pay for this place, the service was not up to par. We had to continually ask for water glasses to be filled and for utensils and it was very loud in the restaurant. Overall good food, but maybe for a week day when it is less busy.

XnljJvOxZlan-FtH40rqbQ.text: Service was excellent. One member of our party had to have his steak re-fired twice, but the manager did the right thing, creating a fan.  I enjoyed the calamari appetizer, the scallops were very good, with a citrus flavor that I'd never experienced before, but found them great. We shared the lobster mashed potatoes and Brussels sprouts as sides.  The smoked old fashioned was good, but the smoke was mostly gone by the time the drink was poured. The Orwin Swift 8 Years in the Dessert was excellent. Great wine list.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. Scallops

Uv_wEUR0UH_7ulQ28J8-mw.text: This was our first time ever going to Eddie V's. The food stands on its own (amazing prime NY strip and Chilean sea bass!!) and the jazz band (that takes requests) was great. But without a doubt, what made our night so amazingly special was George Lee. He is, BY FAR, the best waiter we have ever encountered. He went above and beyond to make sure that we both felt special, and that we truly enjoyed ourselves. His jokes and commentary were hysterical, and he felt like an old friend the way he interacted with us. The complimentary valet parking was just an extra bit of icing on the top (but doesn't compare to the flaming bananas foster we had for dessert). 5 stars; no doubt.

tku94QtcO8H6bOrHs14nIA.text: My favorite restaurant in Charlotte. The food is impeccable. The space is beautiful and the staff is amazing. Use the valet...

t_QNpbL_aZ2Z8QN3GaHHzw.text: Great decoration great service and great food. Last week we went in a large group. We tried a lot of appetizers like oysters, ahi Tuna Tatar, shared Caesar salad and warm goat cheese salad both were super yummy. For entree I ordered Chilean Sea Bass, which was absolutely the best I've ever had. Sea bass was cooked perfectly tender and just well done without being overcooked. Soy sauce was mixed with ginger - great combo. We also shared truffle Mac n cheese and asparagus sides - very tasty. Drinks were good too. The 24 Carat cocktail I got was fruitily yummy. Will come back again!

OY7bUbvDgu0efqNVtwSPkw.text: Large group business dinner.  Seated downstairs in a quiet, private setting.  Best, freshest high-end seafood you will find in CLT.   @Adam was exceptional as our service leader.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States

L6wLqisVuz1_ClB3g2Y-AQ.text: First and foremost. Thank you for making my mom's birthday week so enjoyable. From the beginning our experience was excellent. We came for the Preview Night event. We were greeted at the door and were ushered into the lobby where the hostess welcomed us and gave us the option to go to the bar for a drink first or be immediately seated. I had made my reservation with Gem who was the hostess that seated us and I thanked her for helping me find a reservation time and date that for both my mom's and my schedule. Tyler was our waiter and he was attentive and knew just wanted to suggest for my mom. There was a live band playing and I asked one of the staff who they were  Dominica (  i apologize if I misspelled) relayed  the artist was  AJ Degrassi from California. He covered all genres  of song  while still allowing table conversation to happen without having to raise our voices. I hope there will be weekly live music. The atmosphere is upscale but thembience is relaxed. They have local craft beers available. I had OMB's Hornet's Nest. My mom had their Red Dragon cocktail- definitely recommend. I don't know if it was because it was preview night or not but at Eddie V's there is no skimping on portion sizes. We started with gulf shrimp cocktails and calamari. The calamari could've been an entree itself. It had a Asian glaze sauce with Asian cabbage and carrot mixed in . There's also cashews so nut allergies be advised. Next were our entrees: Parmesan crusted sole with veggies and Bacon wrapped filet with Alaska King Crab and asparagus. I kid you not every bite was flavorful and cooked so well. Truffle Mac & Cheese: Definitely do it. Again the portion sizes are plenty so we asked Tyler to box up the remaining for tomorrow. We ended with a Banana Butter Cream Cake- decadent and sweet! Added bonus it comes with  a scoop butter pecan ice cream. My mom was trying to figure out the recipe to make at home. It was an awesome experience at Eddie V's. My mom and I plan to come back as a special treat every year. The price point is much higher than the average restaurant but the the experience is worth it from the welcoming hostesses, attentive staff,  delicious drinks, savory entrees and decadent deserts. I would definitely recommend Eddie V's Please be advised there are a lot of steps; there is low lighting to add to the ambience so watch your steps. Also the bathroom is downstairs. I'm not sure if there is another bathroom near the bar and the band stage .

Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. Bacon wrapped filet sign Alaskan King Crab with asparagus

zObHfasFGpfjQr0lyJgdXw.text: If you walk into a restaurant where the servers wear all white suits you know you're a bit closer to heaven. Eddie V's is a sure fire touch of class. The service, atmosphere & staff was amazing. Delicious seafood, perfectly seasoned and cooked. Can't wait to revisit.

S8Wh-XxeWwuaiBrqtFUSLQ.text: I went here for a friend's dinner. We were given a private room upstairs. Our server was awesome. We were a pretty big party. I ordered the double chicken breast. It did not disappoint. It was very flavorful and seasoned just right. I loved the and jus sauce that came with it. We shared the sides. They give you big portions of your entree and sides. I loved the corn and scalloped potatoes. Oh and the bread basket was oh so good and ask for melted butter. I definitely recommend this place. The ambiance is nice.

FQYOxrKxN3Cf9wnJdRG8fA.text: This was worth it!!! We went yesterday for a friend's birthday dinner.  When I made the reservation I added a comment that it was a birthday celebration and I wanted something special with the dessert.  We arrived and were escorted to the private dining area and the table was decorated for her birthday.  Black and gold decor circles were on the table and there was a birthday card. We were all surprised.  This was the start to a great evening.   Shane our server was the best!  He obliged our initial picture taking (we wanted to get it over with before the meal started).  He even recommended a picture backdrop and snapped the shots.  The entire night he was attentive and made great cocktail and dinner recommendations.  We will be asking for him again.   Now to the good stuff.  The food.  Wow!  There wasn't one item we order that I didn't enjoy.  We started with cocktails.  I had the Patron Perfect margarita and my friends had Red Dragons.  We started the dining experience by sharing calamari and then two of us had bowls of the crab and corn chowder.  We all ordered the scallops for our entree and shared the half size orders of the truffle macaroni and cheese and sauteed spinach.  Simply delicious!  Dessert was the bananas foster and the Godiva chocolate cake with a cappuccino and regular coffee.  The entire dining experience was top notch.   My only critique would be that we couldn't hear the live jazz music that was playing upstairs. There was some music playing downstairs but I thought I was going to hear a live band.    But as you can see it still doesn't stop me from giving them 5 stars.

Ra_cUID71Cgtuw5VsDFqFA.text: My favorite restaurant to date. Superb service and mouth watering foods! Highly recommend you make a reservation and free valet parking is plus!! Our waiter was named L.A. what a professional; constantly seeing to our needs without hesitation or thought. We had a large party for a birthday celebration and were treated like royalty. We had champagne and the guest of honor had a rose and a card! Plus a live band. Can't wait to go back

sDXBzRrzTjvl-A1FFp8N7Q.text: I'm sure there is a reason why everyone is giving this restaurant 5 stars and wish I had the same experience, but unfortunately that was not the case. We've been to this restaurant many times before in California and it's always been great - so naturally we were excited when it opened up right up the street from us. We usually have date night every Friday night and decided to go to Eddie V's a few Friday's ago. We called and the reservations were booked until 9:30. We said that was fine and we'd come in then. We walked to dinner and arrived at 9:40. We were seated within minutes. The vibe was awesome. So far so good. Then our waiter showed up about 15 mins later - which is quite some time to wait for a waiter for an initial greeting. He finally showed up and asked for our drinks orders, my bf put in a drink and I asked if I could sample one of the Roses prior to purchasing the bottle. He said sure and went missing for 15 mins. Then after flagging him down and reminding him, he came back with my boyfriends drink and my sample. I told him that I'd just do the glass. He said sure and he'd be right back. We sat around for about an additional 15 mins until I flagged him down AGAIN, and asked "Can I get my wine?", rather than saying "Oh no, I am so sorry for the delay!", he answered "Sure" in a monotone voice. He comes back about 10 mins later and my boyfriend and I could finally CHEERS! At this point his drink was warm... He said he'd be right back to take our order - once again, gone for 15 mins. We had to flag down a different waitress that was passing through who was super nice and took our order to relay to our waiter.   Then the food came out - 30 mins later. Calamari was over cooked. Salad was ok. Au gratin potatoes were good. Steak was good. Fish was good.   Overall, the food was ok - something we'd come back for and try different items on the menu. However, the service was the worst we've both experienced EVER and we dine out quite often - all over the world. The server never once expressed an apology, just a "Can I get you another drink? I promise it wont take 30 mins this time." And blamed it on the bar guy - saying they were very backed up. Which if that was the case, and the bar guy really was that backed up, to pour a simple glass of wine, come back and check in on us, don't leave us hanging for 20 mins at a time.   Very very very disappointed.

cHa4AeNrvnK1baPM9G7kkA.text: The atmosphere is great and has potential to be a good restaurant, but the food is mediocre at best. I ordered the shrimp with crab and it was $34 for 5 pieces of shrimp covered with probably a cup of breadcrumbs. Not worth the money at all. The shrimp tasted very chewy as if it was frozen for a long time or cooked and then reused. We also ordered the calamari and it was so chewy I had to spit it out. The rest of my 6 person party felt similarly about their meals. Very pricey for low quality seafood. Felt very disappointed as we were looking forward to a good seafood dinner.

54t7tGudYg_HPrWhkxi2Pg.text: Oysters were fresh, service was extremely friendly (but slow to deliver bar items), vegetarian options were not plentiful, and the seating is expansive.  There are few things I would like to share about our experience at Eddie V's Prime Seafood.  First, we arrived on the 4th of July and were quickly seated by a very professional staff of hostesses and waitstaff.  The menu was explained to our satisfaction and our drink selections were placed accordingly.  We waited an extraordinarily long time for our beverages and even received bread for the table before we had our drinks.  When we questioned the waitress, she said they were on their way.  The bartender then walked over with our sodas, but not the glass of wine that we also ordered.  After a little while longer, we asked the waitress again where our wine was and the bartender walked it over and apologized for the delay and took the glass off our check.  They were not busy, so I am not sure what the hold up was other than the bartender walking drinks out to tables herself.  That's a bit of an odd setup, and perhaps why the drinks were taking so long.  She should not be delivering drinks personally, that is what the waitstaff are for.  Second, our food arrived and we could not have asked for a better spread of food.  It was fresh tasting, piping hot, and served with a smile.  Lastly, the restaurant was kept very clean.  The occasional loud outburst from the kitchen staff made it seem like they were playing around and lacked the professional courtesy that the waitstaff were demonstrating was a bit confusing.  We even heard a manager shush them in an attempt to get the crew back in line.  Overall it was a 4 star experience and I consider myself a hard one to please.  I will certainly be back and hope to see that modifications are made to get beverages out to the tables in a more timely manner.  5 stars for the waitstaff who are very professional!

1oskjaT3ghT87H_gmsLEcg.text: I came here for the first time to celebrate my boyfriend moving in and a promotion. It took awhile to even be acknowledged and then after placing our order took 45 minutes for someone to even acknowledge we hadn't received anything. He told us he would check on our entrees and we hadn't even gotten the salad. Seriously?!? I've been to the capital grille multiple times and have had nothing but amazing service. This was embarrassing. Don't charge the prices you do with service that's shit.

BtMxI7I2l96QQ1Df6M8ZEw.text: I used to love this place. My bf and I sat at the bar to treat ourselves to a nice evening (it's not exactly cheap). The bartender was so rude, and there was a loud, drunk group in a private room (no problem, enjoy yourself!) but, I guess the bartender knew them and as I was midsentence ordering a drink with her a super drunk guy from the group came up and she interrupted me to talk to him... are you serious? Drinks were okay. Bartenders attitude ruined the night for us. Won't be back, not worth the money.

KYr8UXTuQtq2eguJmZuDiQ.text: Went here last night for my anniversary.  Had a reservation and let them know it was our anniversary.  Great vibe at the bar and wonderful live jazz.  Should have stayed there.  After a 10 minute wait?  We were seated downstairs in a back room?  The table did have a heart made of rose petals which was lovely!  And a card which was a very special touch.    Our server was very nice but did not have knowledge about the types of vodka they served? Hmm.  Our oysters were delicious, although 2 had shells in them.  Next up was table side made steak tartare.  Our sweet waiter mashed the heck out of it so much that it was tough when we ate it.  Had to ask for a clean knife ---shouldn't have to. Next up was a delicious lobster bisque but it had this weird mushy cake at the bottom that even the waiter said people hate it.  Finally the entrees---a dry swordfish and a way salty sea bass.  The sea bass was cooked to perfection but hard to eat because it was swimming in an overly reduced salt bath.  Our waiter did give us a dessert to go for our anniversary which was thoughtful.    We also did notice a waiter reset a table and double check the glasses with a flashlight.  That was nice.    Honestly I wanted to love this place and was so excited to come!  Sad it fell short in so many ways.  If I even go back I'll stay at the bar.

kvdnzumqueKHJSTiIj20DA.text: This place has been open for about 3 months, I decided to try it out for Queen's Fest. The ambience is very nice and upscale with beautiful decor and I love that they have live jazz daily, very nice touch! However it is every dark - I noticed 4 tables pull out their phone flashlights to read the menu. The service was a little on the slow slide, but being they're a new restaurant and it's their first time doing restaurant week that was understandable. Our server was very attentive and knowledgeable. I ordered from the queens feast menu, but I added an order of crab stuffed shrimp from the regular menu. I expected it to come out with my entree being I ordered it at the same time, when it didn't come with it I addressed the server who said it'd be coming right up. She then came back and said another server picked it up so they're making me a new one on the house. I honestly think she just forgot to put the order in. Luckily it was free because I don't think it was worthy of $18... I don't know if it was because they were trying to get it out fast but it was more shrimp with crab on top of it and not "stuffed" as I was expecting. Other than that the food was outstanding! I'd definitely go back & highly recommend.

RnFP2-Xpunx4KS4r4-oI3Q.text: Really enjoyed myself here great service Lucky was our server she was the best great food great live music. Will return soon!!!!

zrF-ak6RUMoogLc6QYELCA.text: Amazing food and service.... Doesn't get much better than this place!

QNabmvHVpIUGbs0ikwl2OA.text: Visiting Charlotte and was told this was the place to eat.  Great drinks, the gulf shrimp and lobster tacos were amazing.  We had the Foster banana butter cake,  oh my, it was to die for.   The service was excellent and Sean our server was great

9N6HI-3OD_8TIru7wm3NmQ.text: Amazing food & service! They went out of their way to make sure our first time experience was phenomenal. Loved the live music and the champagne duo. All of food we tried was excellent!

2-j1j9bu_VTMbxLPQ2gw1g.text: This place has definitely moved to my top 5 in Charlotte. Everything from the food to service was top notch, and a beautiful presentation.Started out with Caesar salad which was by far the best Caesar salad I've ever had! Then a steak for my husband which was perfectly cooked and Swordfish for me. The only thing the fish was cooked with was olive oil and lemon but that's all it needed. I could not give a better review on the drinks and deserts though. I had the bananas foster cake oh my god best thing I have ever had!! And husband got the sorbet which was equally amazing! If you like old fashioned you MUST get this bar none best drink! The glass is infused with smoke and they bring it out on a plank board and make it in front of you. Beautiful place, impeccable food, definitely a great addition to the charlotte food scene!!

DoiJje2NnXte-gG0MhASqA.text: This place is absolutely amazing! I recently had my birthday dinner here and it was just perfect. The lighting, the ambience, the live jazz, the attentive and knowledgeable staff were all A+++. And the food is top notch. I had the bacon wrapped filet medallions Oscar style with lump crabmeat and asparagus and it was perfectly cooked and amazing. And they did not skimp on the crabmeat! My friend had the ribeye, which was also cooked perfectly. Actually the best or at least one of the best steaks I have ever tasted. When I came to the table there was a birthday card and confetti on the table for me, which was such a cute surprise. They also gave me a complimentary dessert for my birthday! Get the banana foster cake if you get a chance, the flambe it right at the table and it comes with a scoop of homemade butter pecan ice cream amazingness! The manager came by to say hello and all the stareally made me feel special for my special day. I can't recommend this place enough! They just opened in May and all I can say is welcome to Charlotte and please stay forever!

0IGiUspMlXzW8_NrD1c2sw.text: The drinks are good I had the 24k it was sweet and tart. The salmon was not over cooked and the mix vegetables were not enough for me. They had a young lady singing on the night we went it speakers are facing the bar so sit on the side were the performer is at to here the music. The customer service was good once seat the front staff was ok.

zXw2XiUf_z88csy6Huh4Yg.text: Such a amazing experience, food was top notch, absolutely delicious, and Adam our waiter, AMAZING!! Me and my wife will be regulars.

wqTZ0xDiaZ5RIyudIq9yEg.text: My wife and I selected Eddie V's for our tenth wedding anniversary on the strength of it being a corporate cousin to Capital Grille. CG has always treated us well on special occasions and we had the same expectations for Eddie V's. The restaurant facilities are great, incredibly visual experience. There is live jazz in the bar area, but as we were seated in the back of the dining area we were disappointed you could not hear the performers.   Service was professional, but definitely not prompt (slow).  We both ordered filets "medium" temperature. Mine arrived medium well, over cooked. My wife's was so rare it was all but raw. We never send anything back but we did for my wife's filet. Eddie V's brought a new filet out, again rare, however not as raw as it was previously. We gave up on them getting it correct. We did receive a "free" dessert, implied due to the difficulty of the meal. However, in past experiences at Capital Grille, we received that for booking a special occasion with them.   Bottom line, same expensive prices as corporate cousin Capital Grille, but worse service and food preparation. I regretted we selected it for our tenth anniversary and likely will not return.   Our experience may be unique, I will speak positively to the setting it is visually a cool place to eat in, but the value is not there.

MOPu4u2YWnsVCqbao_uAQA.text: Today, for Thanksgiving, we made our 3rd and final visit to this place.  The food can be great, if you make the right selections.  The problem is that the service has always been horrible.  It is all in the training of staff.  We wait for drinks...we wait for food...we wait for the check.  We wait and we wait.  Once management understands service, it could be a great place.  Unfortunately, we may never know.

UhTSmTBPjeMruHAXSZcMDA.text: Great experience. Made a reservation for two on short notice. Wine selection was fantastic. Attentive and great service. Sashimi appetizer, warm goat cheeae salad and sea bass - every bite was exceptional. I will definitely be back.

XrC_rUXCqJXDMncJzZrZVg.text: This is the best dining experience I've had in Charlotte.... next to capital grille. The food is superb, the service is incredible and the ambience is fantastic. The truffle Mac and cheese is to die for and I'm so happy to finally be able to enjoy real cocktail shrimp! The seafood tower is impressive and filling and the filet mignon is perfectly cooked. I am an absolute fan of this place!

qsVr2Ri_tO_mKWSN4gL6_Q.text: Service was excellent.  Food was absolutely divine, especially the crab fried rice.  Yeah, you read that right.  I'll definitely go back.  Great place!

cJQlTD_Otv7-ZHOXgU1bAw.text: One of my favorite restaurants in Charlotte, Eddie V's never disappoints. They offer valet parking which makes getting there a breeze. The decor and ambiance inside are great and make you feel like you are in an upscale environment. Service has been amazing each time I've visited and we have been well taken care of. They also have some light live band music playing which adds a nice touch.   You can't go wrong with many of the food or drink items here. Everything that I've had was delish. Of course the steaks are great and topped with king crab, even better! I also really loved the bananas foster dessert and the presentation was wonderful for it. The crab cakes are also amazing. I'll be here often on those special occasions!

fjOdH1bTmGqGIllkdX_C3A.text: My first experience at Eddie V's I came into it with super high expectations. Some area were met and exceeded, some not so much . Overall, I enjoyed it for the first time and may be interested in coming back outside of restaurant week.  The restaurant offers complimentary valet parking which is great in Uptown. I didn't get to use it this time because there was a medical emergency outside of the restaurant and I opted for street parking which was less than .1 mile away. No big deal.  I wasn't really greeted as I walked in but I understand as the staff were dealing with the incident that occurred causing the EMT truck to block the right side of the street. We did have to wait a few minutes past 7:30 for our table (party or 7). We were then escorted to a private room which was unexpected and highly appreciated! The ambiance was great including soft playing music, a huge tv which we turned to the NE and KS game and access to set the room's temperature which was a bonus for me because I hate eating dinner and being cold!   Our server , LA, AMAZING! He was super personable and relatable. He really made the experience what is was for me! He was knowledgeable and highly experienced in his field.  I was a little disappointed that I couldn't try the crab chowder because it had bacon in it but for the ladies who wanted to try it they couldn't because they were sold out. That was a bummer and they also ran out of the truffle Mac and cheese.   I ordered the Caesar salad as my 1st course and salmon as my entree. I wasn't wowed by the salmon. It was cooked well but I thought it lacked favor. I tried the fried rice with crab and it was pretty tasty. I'm not a big dessert fan so the options weren't super appealing to me. I was hoping the fresh homemade cookies were chocolate chip but they weren't. My party seemed to really enjoy the Banana Foster and the presentation was cute with the fire ! It did not come with the butter pecan ice cream because I believe they ran out and were served vanilla ice cream instead.   Overall the service was good but I'm not 100% sold on the food for the price whether restaurant week or the normal menu. I'll try it again and see it my opinion changes. It was not a bad experience it just fell a little short than what I was expecting.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States
Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States

LtBNXXfiACXQaVzux7lb4Q.text: Que the music that plays when the ultimate awesomeness is unveiled . I'm UBER excited to have Eddie V in the QC, I am a Eddie V regular back home in Chicago equip with my signature server and all.  I attended a private Yelp Elite event here a couple of weeks back and was so impressed with the staff, food & the space. I met with the sales manager at the event and informed her that I'd like to have my husband Birthday dinner at the restaurant for a party of 6-8 in the coming weeks. I made the reservation and the day before I got a call to confirm in which I informed them that I think I want to do dinner alone with my husband and not with the guest. They kindly updated my reservation and informed me that they were looking forward to see us. Well we arrived and as I learned the day of the private event regarding valet 1. it's complimentary 2. The staff is super friendly 3. it's so high tech where you get a text with your ticket number and you use the link to request you car and get notified when your car is in route and when it arrives.  We were welcomed when we walked in and taken to our lovely booth where a card with "Happy Birthday Marlon" was placed for my husband from the staff. Immediately thereafter champagne  was brought out, mind you I planned none of this then warm bread, butter & an app before we even went over the menu.  Our server Mark was amazing, he was attentive, thoughtful & informative. He made some and amazing suggestions which we went with and were so pleased.  Appetizers: - Kung Pao Calamari - Lobster Tacos  AMAZING I mean just perfect in size and flavor   Main course : 6oz Filet Oscar style King Crab with warm drained butter   Sides: Crab fried rice  Asparagus  Truffle Mac n cheese   Note: A good way to try multiple sides is to get a half order which is pretty big if you ask me.   They even brought out dessert for the Birthday Man :-)  Eddie V's has always been a hometown (Chicago) favorite and I'm so glad they are here in Charlotte now.

Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. After dinner drinks with dessert
Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States

vXBehL5l6PzRm0ZkF4Fjqg.text: Eddie freaking V. Pleased to make your acquaintance. I had seen my Houston buddies take many a Snapchat video of crab fried rice and other mouth watering entrees available here. When I saw the Charlotte Agenda article on restaurants soon to open locally, I was giddy with excitement. I vowed months ago, I would be here on opening night.  Actually, I made it in the day after, but it surpassed my expectations. Our server, Daniel (or David, sorry it was Cinco de Mayo, so I arrived with Patron margaritas flowing in my veins) was on point all evening. Patient, helpful, funny....I can't compliment him enough. We had mac & Cheese, lobster bisque (poured table side!), crab fried rice, lobster tacos, crab cakes, and dessert. The only item I would pass on was the crab cakes and that's only because I prefer it without the breading. But we ate every single bite, so if that doesn't bother you, Order away. The lobster bisque and crab fried rice will be something I will always order on subsequent trips.   The decor is perfect for the area. It's dark and swanky, but still well lit enough to see around. Any date you bring here will be impressed, I know I certainly was.

Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. Interior

EbzggyBwXM2yYATHQ453vw.text: The only reason they get any stars from me is for our server and the food. The hostess stand experience is what lost the rest of the stars.   I made a reservation for dinner and we arrived to the restaurant about 10 minutes ahead of time. The hostess told me our table wasn't ready but we could wait at the stand or sit at the bar until she was ready.   We ended up waiting 25 minutes past our reservation time because it turns out she gave our table away! We came back up to check on our table and she was like, "Uhhhh, I don't have a table. Hold on." Jeez, professional service huh? The worst part was they acted like it was our fault and we never received an apology or comped drink or any acknowledgement of their fault.   Our server was extremely nice and she even apologized on their behalf. She had only been working there for two weeks at the time, so there wasn't much she could do, but I appreciated the apology nonetheless.   We started with the beef tartare, which she mixed table-side. It was fresh and perfectly seasoned.   We then split a ribeye medium rare, king crab legs, and a couple sides, including the lobster mac and cheese and asparagus.   The steak was perfectly cooked as were the crab legs. The sides were okay, but nothing really stood out.   We did get the chocolate cake and ice cream to go (we were only around the corner, so it didn't have time to melt). Definitely get this, it was sooo good!  I doubt I'll return, but time will tell.

qO4eh-bWx4F0SiLXWzglWA.text: Sat in the bar area to listen to the impeccable Jazz trio led by visiting California-based musician, AJ Degrasse. His voice was the highlight of the visit! While there, enjoyed the Heirloom tomato salad, with Italian burrata cheese (perfect for the steamy day outside) and 1/2 a dozen of their fresh, briny east coast oysters: a variety of 4 to choose from (& they also offer west coast oysters).  Finished the night with their smooth primo margarita served up. Opulent ambiance with entertainment & bites to match. Highly recommended.

o68H586jzCaEZ3YoLS-hOQ.text: The food and service is always wonderful! You can't go wrong with any choice, but the crab fried rice is a must!

_F8zglexHQG6SdWBKCtwoQ.text: Everything was amazing didn't even know Eddie V's did bring but it seems they only do brunch on special occasions. Me and my girlfriend went on Easter, it wasn't busy at all. Of course everything was seasoned to perfection, and that honey bun with the lemon glaze on it was incredibly good. Smoked salmon with the cream cheese was good as well. The steak was tender and cooked medium just the way I like it, it was a sunny side up egg so it was a bit runny I should have asked for scrambled. The potatoes were really good as well.

5qyOHsmDKwq6c97hvxBrfg.text: This is one of the nicest (and most expensive) restaurants that I've been to in Charlotte. My husband and I celebrated our 10th anniversary here and the food and service were great! I'd highly recommend for special occasions or when friends are visiting from out of town and you want to show them a grand time. Just make sure you have your credit card ready!

z52tYbWOWHHvTycQrUk54Q.text: Came here for restaurant week. I love the complimentary valet and how it's electronic. Pressing a button to get my car made life easier and then to know the status of where it is. No need in standing outside when it was time to go. Okay now to the foodie experience. The waitress was kind and when my friend started choking, she was very attentive and called for management to address the aftermath. The banana foster was the highlight of my meal. You must get it!   I hear they have live music near the bar, I will have to go back and hangout up there.

pQNRJXEdeZ21x1W90n0aMQ.text: It's been two days and I'm still thinking about the amazing anniversary dinner we had at Eddie V's. This was definitely a splurge meal for us but we declared it was worth EVERY PENNY! The place is spacious and elegant, our waiter "Pax" was attentive and knowledgeable and made us feel really special the whole night.   We went with the idea of getting a tower of seafood (they have two options) but the whole menu looked so good that we decided to pick a little from each section instead. Drinks, my fiance got an old fashioned and I got a delicious Gatsby Sour. We got the half dozen Summer Love Oysters, the cocktail sauce was my favorite to go with these but the vinegar based one was a close second! We got a 22oz. USDA Prime Rib-eye. So tender, buttery and perfectly cooked. We also got Jumbo Lump crab cake.   Tartare Of Pacific Ahi Tuna was our favorite!! What stood out is the mango and citrus that was paired with it. Made it so light and refreshing.   Another favorite was the truffle Mac and cheese! We have tried our fair share of truffle things and this one takes the cake!   If you can't already tell, I'm in love with this place! They insisted that we ordered dessert and I'm so thankful we did we did the banana foster cake and it came out with this cool IG worthy flame syrup to pour on top. The dessert was delicious and it even said "Happy Anniversary" on it.

Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. East Coast Oysters* Summer Love
Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. Truffled Macaroni and Cheese and 22 Oz USDA Prime Bone-In Ribeye*

QUw-TdtQjpPD2kEJRQ-msg.text: Best steak in Charlotte   So far the best steak I've had since living in Charlotte.  We moved from Atlanta less than two years ago.  The ambiance is very nice, the staff was great and the food?  Let's just say we will be back without a doubt.  The spinach is delicious and even though I am allergic to shellfish my wife loved the crab cakes.  The live music is  a nice touch as well.  We chose Eddie V's to celebrate our 14th anniversary.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. Our flaming desert

1tcSreVvDIjyzyi4thEqWQ.text: Eddie V's is our new go-to bar! We have been living in Charlotte for 7 years and every time we get a night away from the kids we usually go to Ruth's for the usual cocktails, bread and food. However, after leaving Ruth's we wanted to find a spot with good cocktails and perhaps a dessert. My husband recommended a place that had a good margarita cocktail and as we were running in the cold, Eddie V's seemed very appealing. Sat down at the bar and both got cocktails, Red Dragon and Patron Perfect Margarita... spot on! We move into the s'mores dessert ( the best dessert in Charlotte) and another round with The Maverick and perfection! We will be back here soon because of the perfect cocktails, delicious dessert and top notch service. Eddie V's is our new favorite place!

44SaYdfd2ceF3G-e2gFbFw.text: This place blew me away with the flavors! Sea bass and salmon with sides of fried rice and asparagus. Every bite I couldn't help but comment on how good it was!! Don't hesitate to come here! Very swanky dim lit interior and there was a live band playing cool late 70s to 80s music.  It is on the more expensive side but trust me worth it for a treat. Your taste buds will thank you. The quality is phenomenal!

eICn-7VOfGjH1QsXrffNSA.text: OK, I'm going down the rabbit trail, but Eddie V missed the mark during Restaurant Week.  The place is gorgeous, hip, and everything one expects at a high dollar place.  So what went wrong?  The menu.  Entrees were teeny-tiny and poorly plated.  My $35 swordfish disappeared on the gargantuan white plate presented to me.  The monochromatic look was highlighted by four pencil-thin, overcooked spears of asparagus.  The fish was thin (1/2"), and helplessly overcooked, too.   So disappointing.  My friends ordered the salmon (overcooked), and a filet which weighed in about 4 oz.  That's an appetizer, not an entree.  When it came to dessert three options were offered:  panna cotta, bananas foster (yummy), and mixed fruit.  Both the women in our party said, "What?  No chocolate?"  Such a simple fix.  I get that Restaurant Week is about lowered prices and packed houses; however, it's also about introducing yourself with your best foot forward.  Attn Eddie V:  you missed it, at least for our party of diners.  I know you can do better since your sister restaurant, Capital Grill nails it everytime, everyday.  Not ready to say, "Give 'em a whirl."

cWSsEvLfNT2vCelXBxJ4jw.text: Nice restaurant in charlotte. I have gone here several times in Chicago and was excited to try it in Charlotte. The place was fully staffed. They offer parking validation if you park in the Bank of America  parking garage. The address for the location if you put in your GPS does not take you to the restaurant. Upon entering I was greeted I had a reservation. I was told everyone in my party had to be present to be seated. The hostess was nice, but some random lady who worked there named Jade made an appearance and was rude. She interjected in the communication and was not polite. She informed me what I was going to do. There was a staff talking to a manager at the front of the restaurant about a problem with a co worker. I was like what am I walking into?! I ended up being seated without all my party being present because they used the Address posted and walked the wrong way. They arrived 15 minutes later. I had the organic salad as an appetizer. It was a nice start. I had the filet minion and potato's as my entree. The potato's were made from scratch. I had the banana foster for dessert. The drinks were good. It was a lovely meal. The restrooms were clean. I liked the decor. I will return to check out their bar scene. They had a jazz ensemble playing and hope the issues at the front were just a bad day thing,

7yZSHK8rM0HLVszWKxui0g.text: This popular seafood spot has made it's way to uptown and I was excited to try a few apps and drinks but I can't wait to return for dinner.  I'm also hoping they consider opening for lunch.  It was pretty busy after work so I placed my order for the crab fried rice and lobster bisque soup.  They have valet parking if you're not able to get street parking.  There was a short wait when I got there as other folk were picking up orders and waiting to be seated.  It's a very swanky restaurant with a huge following as everyone seemed to know that the food was good.  I will certainly return for dinner at some point but the crab fried rice was good...too much egg for me so I'll know to omit it the next time...and the lobster bisque was amazing.
