zNmBsHv4VrSFaNk0NdV__g.text: I visited Eddie Vs to try it out during restaurant week/ Queen's feast. Although we had reservations, there was still a wait. The restaurant was pretty busy as to be expected but our waiter was great so it wasn't that bad. Everything tasted ok. I later realized the dessert had Bacardi in it which explained the weird taste I couldn't figure out. Overall, it was a pretty good dinner and I would go back when it's not restaurant week to try something else.

_wP1XrinLhWZyxSbvofIig.text: So I've now been here twice, I try not to do a review after a mediocre experience which the first one was. And that mostly had to do with the lack of knowledge my server had and the food wasn't anything special that visit. Now this past visit during Restaurant week, was great minus the fact we had a reservation and we all were there 15mins earlier and even though she informed us our table was ready we couldn't be seated until the exact time and then they still sat us 5 minutes late.  Once seated our server Natalie greeted us with a big smile and let us know that she can answer any questions we may have or find the answer if she doesn't know. Which I was very happy to hear since my last server didn't even try. Natalie was on it all night, very friendly and attentive.  I started with the Caesar which was okay but the few that ordered the crab & corn chowder just about licked the bowl so I'll be trying that next time. The Filet Mignon with truffle mashed potatoes was delicious and cooked perfectly. Last but not least the Banana Foster Butter Cake for dessert, I was already full so I didn't think I would eat it but when I say I ate every last bite because it was so good. If I come back for nothing else I'll make sure when I have a sweet tooth I come get that!

Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. 8 oz Center Cut Filet Mignon* with truffle mashed potatoes

DbIaGsLGXoOLge3lxhnatw.text: I visited Eddies this past Saturday and OH MY GAWD!!! Everything was great!! Very beautiful restaurant and a great ambience.  We started with a jumbo crab cake (s/o to other yelpers cause I chose this dish based off reading reviews) and it was EVERYTHNG!! We also got rockafella oysters they were okay.  To drink I order a Red Dragon which is one of their signature drinks and it was good. It's a play on a mojito so if you don't like muddled fruit don't get this.  We had the ice berg blt salad (one is big enough to split) i'm personally not a fan of wedge salad or blue cheese but my guy enjoyed his portion.  For our entrees I ordered the scallops, they were good and so filling, did not have that too fishy taste that scallops usually have so that's a plus for me.  My guy order the steam sea bass, such a large portion and it taste great, the sauce that it rest in is so good. He also enjoyed using his chop sticks to eat it.  Being that it was our first time here we wanted to try everything so we also got an indulgent, the stuff jumbo shrimp. Trust me just go ahead and add it to your order, you'll only be disappointed that your too full to eat anymore. I also order the lobster mashed potatoes, I was too full to finish so had them for breakfast the next day and they were good.  For dessert we had the banana's fosters with vanilla ice cream and when I tell you I've been dreaming about it since Saturday. One bite and all your worries are removed. It's just that good.  The best thing about our experience though was our server, Justin and his serving assistant (I didn't catch her name). Just was so helpful in giving suggestions and recommendations to us newbies. Even though he was busy he made sure that not only us but all his tables were taken care of. He also made arrangements for us to move upstairs to a bar table to hear the band once we finished eating. Justin was so nice and professional and he's nice eye candy #KEEPHIM!!  My only complaint is they do not have apple Ciroc at the bar and my Long Beach ice tea didn't quite taste right none then less my first experience at Eddie V's was great and I will be back.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. George Banks Scallops

ETJMd3Oddmu-Pp3cyHaZtw.text: We visited this place during restaurant week so it was super busy but we didn't partake in the restaurant week menu because there were specific things we wanted to try... The restaurant is super romantic and the ambience is very laid back.  The bartenders were nice but seemed very busy and almost unable to manage the crowd.   Listen.... this place is SUPER expensive but the quality is amazing. My only complaint is the price of the shrimp cocktail for only FOUR SHRIMP!!!  The sea bass is absolutely insanely DELICIOUS.  The truffle mac & cheese was perfect and had more than enough chunky lobster!  The filet Oscar was definitely worth even penny.  Get ready to spend easily $250 for dinner. It's worth it once in a while.

Vj-yBSIWmq6B1Rhqzc0reA.text: Love the bar area here and that is a little separated from the actual dining area.  All of the staff have been welcoming and friendly as well as helpful.  The food is really good and I love the understated decor.  We definitely have added this to our date night list!

iIH2DbXWCD5veYizUV9xtQ.text: I came here for a work dinner. I thought this place was solid. Not the best food ever, but not the worst either. It's perfect for what it is, a big box high-end chain restaurant. I think the food at Ruth Cris' and Capital Grille is better, but the ambiance here is much more lively than those two places . It's a great place for drinks after work or meeting a date.   Food: B- Ambiance: A+ Service: A-

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States. Shrimp were also solid. Not the best but solid.

fDthl5yTlHQFmvtFBETyeg.text: So ya'll remember me and my first experience with Eddie V's on Mother's Day 2018.  I could not rave enough. Well, I have been back several times since then. Happy Hour the most, but I have to say, I was there yesterday for Easter brunch (along with my visiting daughter and a few lady friends) and we could not be more pleased!  First, our server, Jahniece White, was the sweetest, most accommodating waitress I have ever encountered. She was very attentive, but not overcrowding. She was knowledgable of the menu and her description of our food and drinks was on point.  Now, the food...  I've had several off the items on the brunch menu in the past and decided to try something different (Lobster Quiche Florentine). I was a little skeptical at first, as most quiche I have tried tend to be a bit dry. Boy was I in for a surprise! This quiche was a light and heavenly delight, wrapped in a crispy, buttery pastry (Hallelujah!). My daughter had the shrimp and grits, which was a creamy and flavorful dish. One of my friends "nameless" had the steak dish, but I didn't get a pic of it, as she went in too fast and furious before I could snap the camera. Actually, we all attacked our dishes pretty shamelessly! Dessert came out and took it to another. A few of us had the panna cotta, while others enjoyed the design of bananas foster and we shared the sorbet, uhm, uhm, uhm... (can I get some more napkins, please)  We stayed well past the Brunch hour, but the staff was very polite and did not try to rush us out. When we noticed the dinner crowd being seated, we decided it was time to take our full bellies and roll each other to the car.    What a wonderful experience. I knew this would be a great location, as it was created in my name sake EV's, which could be short for Evelyn's #1 Uptown Charlotte dining location.  Thank you for such a beautiful meal!

27gpp6Nsf2inQUPgUUDB1Q.text: Color me impressed. Finally made it to Eddie Vs myself and a few friends went for dinner and drinks. The ambiance here is stellar for sure. Me being the yelper that i am i couldn't wait to take pictures in front of the crystal curtains with the fish statue leading downstairs to one of the dinning areas where we were seated. I must mention they offer complimentary valet parking which is a plus especially when it comes to downtown with the parking prices.  The waiter and waitresses were dressed nice in a white jacket and black tie, with black slacks they were presented quite nicely. On to talk about the menu and food. I ordered the giant crab cake which the waiter told me it was no need to order anything else because it was very filling and indeed it was. Drink of my choice was the 24 karat gold, what a name right? Nice touch with adding the gold sparkling salt around the rim. How can i forget about the relaxing smooth jazz music playing when we arrived and i believe at 6pm thats when the live jazz player comes in and plays his saxophone. For anyone looking for a nice date night with a great ambiance and aesthetics Eddie V's is the place to be!

ivHv0fXUdpiT3KC4KyV_HQ.text: This just may be one of the best steakhouses in town! I ordered the crab & corn chowder to start, which was so flavorful. Next was the 8oz filet, which literally melted in my mouth. My husband also ordered a filet mignon, cooked Medium, but was actually cooked more on the Medium Rare side.  This is why I can't give it a perfect 5 stars. For desert, we had the Bananas Foster cake, which was served warm with ice cream. So delicious!  The service was outstanding and what you would expect from an upscale steakhouse.

o5ErYgNBlYwlYXwxkxsSQQ.text: I was very lucky to attend a private event here in the dining rooms beneath the main floor. The venue is stunning and was perfect for an intimate night of mixing and mingling. The staff at Eddie V's was attentive to every guest and so accommodating. No glasses were left empty and plates were always promptly cleared.  This used to be a building for Bank of America and the rooms for private events used to be vaults. There is a really cool sophisticsted ambiance throughout the entire place, but these rooms were the best. I highly recommend you visit them for your own private party.  Appetizers and drinks were all delicious. It has a great location right on Tryon uptown with a valet for parking.

io8COgSG6kRY7OuZI2Ezww.text: I came on a Wednesday night and I was impressed.  The waiter was very attentive and polite.  We started with lobster bisque!  It was so good and tasty... yummy.  I had Prosecco as my drink and order the crab cake as my meal.  I got to sample the seafood rice from a friend and whoa, it was delicious.  We ended with the banana foster that was just enough and everything was so delicious!  I will definitely be returning here.

ExGHXcjf2nMkoNGWlxgHzQ.text: Was here for a birthday celebration. I have to admit. The staffs, George Lee, Lucky and Abby are impeccable when it comes to their customer services. They all mingles and crack jokes like we're almost friend. Very entertaining. Here's what I ordered  The lobster bisque. 3/5 it's ok, it's creamy but tomatoes tasting and very little trace of lobster. The presentation are because and exciting but that's the end of that?  The Oscar style filet with king crabs: 3/5 The cream sauce was too salty therefore threw the whole filet off.. I couldn't finish it. The king crab is also ok but again it's he sauce..   After I got home from the restaurant. I was sooo sick.. Tummy hurting and all.. so I don't know what it is..  all and all. The amount of money I paid was a lot. The experience was awesome due to the food presentation and the staffs making it memorable. But I wasn't happy to pay for a $55 steak and be sick.. may think twice about going back..

R8ji9XI7uNIIegfCshLS4g.text: Our waitress was wonderful. Had a reservation and wasn't seated until 30 minutes after but everyone that passed us insisted it was worth the wait. The food was just ok to me, besides the crab cakes which are to die for. Lots and lots of crab. We ordered a good amount of food. I am a foodie and so is my husband. We had the lobster tacos (good), lamb lollipops (sooooo good) and ordered scallops, stuffed jumbo shrimp and chicken with mushrooms for main course. The seafood here is definitely the best thing on menu. The sides are just ok. We ordered the truffle Mac and cheese, lobster mash, scalloped potatoes and crab rice. The atmosphere is so beautiful. I would recommend going during happy hour and taking advantage of those prices because to pay regular price for the food is not worth it. FYI we also waited a terrible long time for apps so the manager comped those which was nice.

Let's just say, you'll want to enjoy the company your with.  Ambiance was fabulous. And our server Culton was really great!!             --  I really do want to love this place!!   --  Bread- good, but watch your teeth or the roof of your mouth. The outside was so hard my teeth did a double take.  Beverages: Gin a soda- Hendrick, soda, lime, cucumber- excellent!!  Salad: Amazing heirloom tomatoes, balsamic vinegar, cheese, & basil. Sides: Mac n cheese plain with no lobster- It was a very sharp cheddar. More than what my taste likes. Not necessarily bad.  Yucky mashed potatoes. I got them plain. They came with scallions, dry, and not hot.. hardly warm  Potatoes a gratin- OMG so delicious!! The real reason to come back. I loved them!!!  Dessert: Peach cobbler- more like an over sweet pie.  Vanilla ice-cream - I loved it  Butter pecan ice-cream- my friend liked it, I did not

3sFDQwYjN2l7KCFpg4D8RQ.text: Our first time at Eddie V's Seafood. We live in Uptown so had wanted to try it for some time. They valet park as well as validate parking if you use the BofA parking deck on college. My wife loves seafood, it was Mother's Day and we read reviews on what they were known for and set our food selections based on recommendations we had read about. In the end we selected Eddie's based on a particular selection they have called The Big Eddie, a shellfish dish consisting of King Crab Legs, Maine Lobsters, Ahi Tuna Poke, Shrimp, and Oysters - dish is for two. We had a dinner reservation for 7pm and were there on time. We were told it would be 10 minutes or so before our table would be ready, no worries we went to the bar for a drink to kill the time! The interior is beautiful, they did a really nice job on the high end look of the place. I ordered the Smoked Old Fashioned, a recommendation. Shortly we were seated, having our drink selections transferred to our table. The waiter came by and we gave him the order since we already knew what we wanted. He informed us they were out of  The Big Eddie, the lobster specifically. Well given that was why we came, that ruined the experience that a high end Seafood restaurant was out of one of they classic dishes, and the lobster! I ended up getting a 12 oz steak and my wife already very very disappointed got the scallops and a side of crab legs. We also got the crab fried rice which was recommended. While we waited we had bread delivered to the table. We waited for a while for the bread plates but they never arrived. Finally a friendly guy came by and asked if we needed anything and he quickly brought the plates but by that time we were already eating the bread. When our order arrived, they served me the steak I had ordered with a side of crab legs and my wife got a plate of scallops! See picture, half of her order was on my plate. We later ordered dessert. Don't get me wrong the food was good, my steak was cooked just right, my wife's scallops and crab legs (which were already cut in half to ease getting to the meat) were excellent also. But the experience for a high end pricey restaurant was far from feeling high quality from the customer standpoint, in fact from our view it was disappointing to say the least. The staff (waiter) specifically knew the experience did not sit well with us, so he asked us to give them a second chance in the future. Not sure what to think, but I expect more from a high end place like this, good food but the high end experience was far from what customers should expect.

K6k-fmDamYPu8DykMSa68w.text: I've only been to EV's for drinks, dessert or to enjoy the Friday night live band. It's a great atmosphere and the band plays a variety of great music.   The Bananas Foster is AMAZING. It's the perfect blend of buttery, caramel and cream. Plus, the dish is served and flambe table-side. Matched with a Kahlua and coffee, is a great night cap to a night out.   If you plan to visit on a Friday...make a reservation or get there early. Fills quickly!

HEjxtwADfm_7fLZY0-9q7g.text: Eddie V's is a wonderful place for a special date night. I've been to the one in Tampa, and now the most recently opened one in Charlotte.  In Tampa I had the crab cake as an appetizer and it was ah-amazing. However,  the one in Charlotte, didn't quite match up. I could've done without the panko on top.  Now to the good stuff. Their crab and corn chowder is so so delicious, full of crab and very hearty.  I usually get the Jumbo Gulf Shrimp that is stuffed with crab. My husband usually gets some type of steak or red meat.  The shrimp is delicious. I must say though, eat it with the sauce it comes with (I usually order extra)..definitely takes the dish to the next level :)  My husband has had the bacon wrapped filet topped w/king crab and the rib eye. Which he said he enjoyed both.  We also get the crab fried rice as a side. Tastes like your typical fried rice, just with a lot if added limp crab meat. Pretty good.  I will admit for 2 ppl, it's super easy to spend $200+ here (especially if you're ordering drinks). So definitely a special occasion place, not quite an every Friday place. Will we be back? Absolutely.

ksuN9ry2gQWbRakH2VEsOA.text: I work in uptown and couldn't wait to try this place out! Finally made it for my anniversary dinner and we were truly impressed. Our server Justin was attentive and informative. We started our meal with a dozen oysters from the west coast. Let. Me. Tell. You. They were the best oysters I've had hands down. Their sauce made from champagne I believe was sooooo good. Our entrees included the lobster pot, bone in ribeye, lobster mashed potatoes, and asparagus. Everything was very good but the lobster mashed potatoes were the most memorable. We also ordered crepe brulee... but I'm still waiting on it to be delivered. I definitely recommend this place for any special occasion.

28YFHFNHqoQQTQ5pfsOGhw.text: We had a really great NYE at Eddie V's! We had a reservation for 9 at 6PM and were promptly sat at our table.   We used the complimentary valet - which was super convenient and necessary given the lack of parking near the restaurant.   We started with cocktails. I ordered the pomegranate mule which was made with Tito's vodka. It was really tasty and served in a steel mule cup.   My husband and I shared an order of the calamari. It was cooked perfectly. Crispy and not oily. It was a massive portion.  I ordered the scallops and my husband ordered the chilean seabass. Both were delicious. The portion size was huge. We split a side of the brussel sprouts - again, very tasty.  Jazz music played in the background and it was just a really wonderful NYE dinner!  We look forward to coming back to Eddie V's in the future!

5KN3AbnInMPOOom2pGZl4A.text: I am in Charlotte working for the next month and I wanted a Negroni cocktail. Where I live we celebrate NEGRONI WEEK and the best part about that week is every bar participates, they get creative and some of the proceeds go to help local animal shelters. So you get to have amazing craft cocktail while helping puppies and kittens. So I was excited to have one here.   We stepped into Eddie Vs and I loved the vibe immediately. It was a bustling after work happy hour scene along with people who came to dine. The bar was nice and no one waited for a cocktail or a refill as all the bartenders helped each other.   Welp!!! There was no Negroni to be had but our Bar God Patrick suggested the Jasmine as he was out of sweet red Vermouth. The Jasmine ended up tasting like the Negroni's cute little sister. It was super yummy.   Let's chat about those noms noms they were offering. The tuna tartar was so fresh and the sliced grapefruit added the perfect acid to the tartar. The shasimi was delicious and the sauce that they had it in was so good I could've licked the plate. The Calamari was really good as well.   I can't wait to go back.....

ytTsk1GqP1aw1nfVFWD82g.text: Full disclosure, I'm the current Duke of the Capital Grille and I might just have to make an effort to become the Duke of Eddie V's, it was that damn good!  Went on a Thursday evening for a Christmas gathering of friends and co workers.  Party of 6, made reservations and everything was set.  Showed up and the valet has this text message thing which was a great touch...no tickets and you can hit a button and request your car.  Love it!!  Was introduced to our server, Pax.  He has been there a few months but came from Del Friscos' so he knows what hes doing.  I was there with 2 wine experts, but Pax being a Sommelier as well as a bad ass server was on point and kept up with the wine knowledge.    Started off with a few oysters a piece which were nice, fresh and well done with the accompaniments.  We had appetizers next and the tuna tartare with the pepper jelly was simply amazing.  Everything was served at the peak of freshness.  I got to try the calamari which was "asian style" with nuts and lots of noodles.  Different, but well done.  Sweetie had the shrimp cocktail which she enjoyed.  Now, to the main event.  I ordered the bone in NY Strip, medium rare.  I didn't opt for the fancy sauces or added lobster tails just the way God intended it...meat.  This dam steak was the definition of perfection.  I'm typically a Ribeye guy but my co worker talked me into the strip.  It was cooked a perfect medium rare, not a second over on the grill.  Seasoning was amazing and the piece of meat was juicy, plump and was 100% satisfying.  I can't say enough about how great this eating experience was.  The ambiance of Eddie V's was wonderful.  I think this was a Bank of America Lobby and the poor servers had to walk up and down a long flight of stairs to the kitchen but they were all hustling and very attentive.  Great Job Eddie whoever you are!  I'll hope to see you soon!

-KwYTAjF6YWlWApq53cgBg.text: Everything about this place was 5 star worthy!!! The cocktail at the bar while we waited for our groups table to be ready was unique and delicious. knvn2NoJV8hjPjFJQwOjKw.text: Booked venue with Bryce for a corporate dining event. It was perfect. Food, room, drinks, service were AMAZING. We all loved everything about the experience. Absolutely recommend!  Food was delicious! Drinks were great. Loved loved loved it.

fBR8q9c7eohCN55B7tQrJA.text: What a huge disappointment. We wanted to have a nice dinner while visiting Charlotte, and boy did we pick the WRONG place. At first they tried to sit us downstairs in an enclosed room. After letting them know, we did not like the feeling of being confined, we felt the attitude completely change by the hostess. "Follow me" is all she said and took us up to the main floor. I apologized but it was ignored. It felt like major attitude from the hostess area, hidden behind a nice atmosphere.   The food was OK. Biggest disappointment was the filet. I ordered the bernaise on the side because restaurants tend to overdo it. The bacon was burnt on the edges and falling off. I don't even understand the point of the bacon. On the non-burnt parts, the bacon was chewy and wet. The filet itself was tasteless. And the crab on top was not tender at all. It was more stringy than anything.   The oysters were unremarkable. The shrimp was stuffed with more bread crumbs than anything. The goat cheese mushroom salad was uncomfortable to eat. I felt I shouldn't have to cut that salad, but I did and I had to add a bit of salt!  Overall, we left feeling horrible about just dropping $200 on a nice meal that was definitely not the experience we had in the past elsewhere and hoped for. :(

DXaW7npc7zSPL0zqlIbUew.text: * * * UPDATE As of Tuesday, August 13, 2019  Owner - DARDEN GROUP (Florida) Spoke w/Falon Farrell VP of Operations   Eddie V's Prime Seafood; Charlotte NC This incident happened on Thursday, July 25.   Bryce Harman is still employed with Eddie V's  He's Managing Partner. We were told by Falon Ferrell they are still investigating the incident.    First, we were told an independent investigation would be done, that didn't happen, the investigation was conducted by two staff members from their HR department.   Secondly, Falon stated 20 African American employees were interviewed and NO ONE stated that he was a racist. Why only question African Americans, why not white employees as well. That is a form of racism, (Racial PROFILING) when you only target one race of people. Does he only work with African Americans? Corporate doing this is problematic in itself!   Thirdly, Falon, stated the company has ZERO tolerance for racism. So why is Bryce still employed?  Why wasn't this matter handled by an independent group? When he has admitted  that he made the statement to us. "YOU PEOPLE WOULDN'T BE EATING HERE IF IT WASN'T RESTAURANT WEEK."  Finally, She stated at this point Bryce Harman will be attending "Sensitivity training classes," How do you come to a conclusion before the investigation is completed?  "WE ARE NOT SATISFIED"  Bryce said to my husband and I "YOU people wouldn't be eating here if it wasn't restaurant week..." rKP0ExekhoD4NYv4lcNwow.text: I'm reviewing for a private party we hosted for our clients. We made a reservation for 12 and we we're pleased to find when we arrived that we would be placed in a private room - which also had a TV. We had two main servers who were great, and could easily walk us through the menu. We all started with a few bottles of wine (they have a nice extensive list and will let you try any prior to ordering if you would like) along with the calamari, tuna & beef tar tar. Personally I thought the calamari was the best of the selection-it was served over a bed of crispy noodles and veggies with a spicy asian sauce on it. Also the portion size was huge and would be a great option if you came here for Happy Hour!   For my meal I got the jumbo shrimp stuffed with crab. They were a little crispy, but had great flavor and the shrimp were huge. A few other coworkers got the sea bass and filet and said it was amazing! We also shared a variety of sides, including the truffle mac and brussels, but the crab fried rice was the best of all! I would hands down go back to Eddie V's and order the Calamari and Crab fried rice at the bar + order some drinks.   And last, but not least you gotta get the banana fosters dessert. They light it on fire and it tastes pretty darn good!  Overall we had a great time at Eddie V's and our client thought it was the BEST meal they had in Charlotte - and we've taken them to nearly all the restaurants in Uptown.  The only downside is that it's a little pricey, but they do run a special during Restaurant Week if you want to try it out!   If you're looking to plan a nice private party, you gotta check out Eddie V's and ask for the private room!

ncA3QCRr1Tt1-SyOx_UHQw.text: 6 stars for service  4 stars for food   Want to feel special on a special occasion?  Eddie V's will rise to the occasion!  Service extremely professional and helpful but with an air of friendliness.  They went out of their way in the details to provide for our experience of celebrating an anniversary.   The mozzarella/tomato salad very fresh- at first disappointed by size but flavor made up for it.  Wedge had a bit too much dressing on husband's.  Husband got bacon wrapped filet- perfectly prepared and I had the jumbo shrimp that perhaps slightly over cooked but still tasty.  I would NOT recommend Brussels sprouts here- missing a flavor profile.  I actually took home- chiffonaded them and added some acid and seasoning for another meal.   We will return.

WghiFEOH-wcGsBdv9MVGnw.text: What a fantastic dining experience! My husband treated me to my birthday dinner here and we both had a fabulous evening. The waiter was great -very attentive, good suggestions. Manager came to check on us and asked if we were there for date night or special occasion. They brought out an awesome, complimentary dessert and wrote happy birthday on dish. A really nice extra touch. I had the caprese salad to start. So much flavor! The cheese wasn't mozzarella but was even better. Worth getting for sure. But the star was my husband's crab & corn chowder. It was so good, seriously so dang good, I would go back just for that haha. Drinks were quite tasty and reasonably priced. Fresh fruit muddled and quality ingredients. We both had filets and they were cooked perfectly. Had Brussels sprouts and au gratin potatoes. Potatoes were not our favorite but that didn't mean we didn't enjoy them. Easily could have gotten one side to share but we splurged! Had a wonderful evening and we look forward to going back! Cheers!

4Ei_FhJ3ETo-1zeW1imzDA.text: Let me start by saying that this was a very important business dinner; my FIRST that I planned at my NEW job!  So... I really can't thank Eddie V's enough for doing its due diligence to make this a True success!    First, we were given one of the private rooms downstairs.  This was a beautiful space, which allowed for conversations to happen with ease.  Our server, Corbin was on point!  He knew everything & took his time with us.  We were not just waited on, but cared for during the entire time.  Other staff helped with water & bread refills & no matter where we went, we were pleasantly greeted.  Now, the food. Just wow!  My scallops were divine!  Best I ever had!  Everyone enjoyed their dishes.  The shared portions were plenty for our group and with all the bread, they left feeling very satisfied.  It was an extremely great experience from beginning to end that our guests felt compelled to give me all the kudos!  So I wanted to give it right back to Eddie V's.

8J9PSnfYBEGiGIx8R7lItA.text: Came here one weekend with my sister and her husband. We literally tried almost everything lol. I did the blue point oysters that were to die for, the lamb lollipops that were delicious, and for my main entree I had scallops, the potatoes, asparagus, and Brussels sprouts. MY FOOD WAS DELICIOUS.   My sister and brother-in-law had the chicken, two orders of crab cakes, lobster tacos, crab fried rice, Mac and cheese, crab stuffed shrimp, and the lobster potatoes.   We shared our sides and of course tried each other food.   My favorites were the lamb lollipops, oysters, and scallops lol. The sides were good, but they weren't the best I ever had lol. Service was good, but a little slow. The manager came to the floor and apologized about the wait. I was too busy enjoying my food that I forgot about the wait once I started eating lol, but she actually gave us our appetizers for free which was certainly not requested or expected!    I'll go back for sure!

edOYGZwl9YtWgUvL9YxNow.text: Took my daughter for her 24th birthday. We made reservations on-line early that afternoon for a 6pm seating.  Once we entered we were greeted and taken to our reserved table. Customer service is phenomenal and the food was great. It is pricy, however you are paying for exceptional service. We had the Lobster Bisque, Crab Fried Rice, Truffled Macaroni and Cheese, Parmesan Sole, Jumbo Gulf Shrimp, and Red Snapper.  They were all great. My favorites were the Lobster Bisque, Jumbo Shrimp, and Mac 'n Cheese.

gwfMKQKg0Vm2WB1qoMkGmA.text: Eddie V's was perfect for our birthday dinner .   I will start off by saying I didn't like that they didn't let those that made reservations that valet parking wouldn't be available Friday night at peak hours . It took us 40minutes to find parking , but they were very apologetic for the inconvenience.   We started off with the lobster tacos, I wasn't aware they weren't all corn tortillas , but I only have a gluten sensitivity not intolerance . After they knew I didnt eat gluten,  they catered all my following meals to be gluten friendly.  The lobster tacos were delicious! We would go back and order these times 3 lol.   Our second course , we ordered the ceasar and BLT salads . Well prepared and DELICIOUS! Housemade , flavorful dressings, farm to table tomatoes on the salads, and a large portion . I honestly was full after the appetizer and second course .   Our entrees were , an 8oz and 12oz filet mignon, one with blue cheese fondue, and both with crab stuffed grilled  shrimp.   We ordered the small bacon brussel sprouts and truffle mac and cheese (not pictured) as sides. The steaks were cooked perfectly, and the grilled shrimp were a nice indulgence to pair with the filet .   As a complimentary birthday dessert he had a cast iron apple pie with a scoop of vanilla bean icecream drizzled with caramel . It was a large amount of food and leftovers were plentiful and reheated nicely the next day .  The next time we visit I will request to sit near the bar area, there was good , upbeat music being played which I would've loved with our dinner , but no complaints with any of the service or food , 5 stars indeed.

USRkF9CW4U_XEBL_fOptuQ.text: This place sure does know how to make a girl feel special!   I came here with some friends to celebrate my birthday dinner. To start they had the table decorated so nice! They also gave me a card from my the while Eddie V family. It was such a nice touch!   Our server was kind and knowledgeable. She really added a level of greatness to the evening. I started with the Gatsby Sour. It definitely packs a punch. If you like your drinks strong, this is the one for you.   For dinner I opted for the crab cake and the filet. I shared my sides with the table, we ordered the spinach and Parmesan, brussels and bacon and potatoes.   The crab cake was cooked perfectly. It was packed with crab meat. I would absolutely order it again. The filet was also very tender and delicious. It was cooked to perfection and seasoned so well. I recommend ordering both entrees. You will not regret it.   My favorite sides were the potatoes and brussels and bacon. I mean how could you ever go wrong with potatoes and any dish with bacon. I don' recommend the spinach. It's missing something and the pieces of parmsean laid on top don't add to the dish.   For dessert I had the banana foster and it's totally worth saving room for it!   Thank you Eddie V's for making my birthday so special and for having some damn good food! I can't wait to come back.

iAAEyQDVa1VE1ugQ-7j5QA.text: I am obsessed with Eddie V's. Fantastic food, atmosphere, and service. I have dined at all of the steakhouses in Charlotte, and in my opinion Eddie V's is by far the best!   We had dinner here on NYE with a group of 10. The restaurant was packed, but the service was still superb. As we dined we listed to the beautiful live jazz music. We had cocktails, wine, apps, and entrees. We loved the jumbo lump crab cakes and my filet was cooked to perfection. The restaurant is beautiful and you are treated like royalty. The complimentary valet is a great perk as well.   My husband and I also had a 25 person wedding party here in one of their private rooms. We worked with Laura Green and she was phenomenal. We chose a customized menu for our event, signature cocktails,  a unique seating situation, etc. Laura was so helpful and attentive in these decisions. We also had a cake and flowers brought in for the event, and the Eddie V's staff ensured everything came together seamlessly. If you are looking to host a wedding party, birthday, corporate dinner, or any special occasion - Eddie V's is your spot!   We can't wait to visit again!!

eZOP5mYHagX1mRlQyv7Y3Q.text: I cannot recommend this restaurant highly enough for the incredible experience my family and I had. First, the food was excellent. My ribeye was cooked to perfection and the Bananas Foster is one of the best desserts I've ever had.  But i want to commend the restaurant for its service this particular night. My son spilled a Shirley Temple at our table and that red grenadine leaves quite a mark on pristine white tablecloths. So a guy came by and said "I'll be back with my team." 15 seconds later 5 people came to our table, the four of us got up and these employees switched out our tablecloth, napkins, glasses and silverware with a speed to match a top-notch F1 racing pit crew.  We then asked if the restaurant has crayons or something for our son to keep busy with. The manager came back with a Crayola box of 64 crayons and paper to draw on. She said "we didn't have anything so I got these from the store down the street." THAT is SUPER service.  Thank you Eddie V's staff for making our night one to remember.

ia8l3g4sJLi7KytIlzD2bQ.text: Food was delicious!  I had the salmon, butter poached lobster mash and asparagus.  I also had the banana foster for dessert.   My first time there and will be back!

xQ1zW9545Ml8F2ppqfwS9A.text: We tried Eddie V's out for the first time during restaurant week. We had a little confusion with the hostess not understanding our whole party was there so we had to wait for 10 minutes extra but no big deal! We got seated and ordered and the bread is delicious! I ordered the ceaser salad which was really good with homemade croutons and a tapenade. My husband got the crab and lobster bisque which was so good and had big chunks of crab and lobster!  We did wait a while for our bottle of wine to come. It came just as we finished our appetizers which was a little slow but everything else came out in a good amount of time.  I ordered the Norwegian Salmon which was really flavorful and cooked perfectly. The spinach side was okay but nothing amazing. Everyone who got filet said it was cooked perfectly (from rare to medium) and so tender. For dessert we ordered the panna cotta and bananas foster. Both were delicious!  Food portions were a little on the small side if you were paying full price but for restaurant week it was perfect.

DIMfgM6IbgY3IQyURvomiw.text: This was my first time visiting Eddie V's and I've heard so many greats things about them so of course when my friend was having a birthday gathering I was looking forward to trying their food. It's the best seafood you'll ever try they said, It's like eating at a Michelin Star Restaurant they said, it's the best experience they said. Well here is my take:  My friend's party had 18-19 guests in total so of course I was looking for more than one waiter or at least the best they had. Our waitress was extremely nice  but like most places they have several tables so unfortunately the service suffered a little. Me and my fiancee and another couple ordered 2 bottles of wine $80 each which she poured fine, we sipped and all things are great. We drank the glass pretty quickly  and because this is a "high class" establishment we waited for our waitress to pour another glass which took like 20 mins so we ended up grabbing our own bottle and refilled our glasses.   We eventually got to ordering appetizers which OMG the crab cakes & West Coast oysters were freaking amazing! The Calamari not so much, very greasy but the flavors were there just a disappointment because I love calamari like breathing air lol. There were a few appetizers ordered which I'm told were great but I can only speak to mine. After the transition from appetizers to entree orders the waitress put the menus on the floor which I thought was kind of weird and again I'm expecting 5. I've tried tons of 3-5 restaurants in NYC and sadly this I feel like took away from the experience. I'm paying $35-$50 for just an entree and $80 bottle of wine I expect and demand more.  I ordered the Stuffed Shrimp with Crab which the Shrimp was over cooked. The couple across from me and another guest also ordered this and each one was over cooked. I wanted to send it back but didn't want to wait nor complain at this point. My fiancee ordered the Chilean Seabass which had way way way to much teriyaki sauce which masked the taste of this beautiful fish. The Seabass was cooked to perfection, light, fluffy and just treated with the upmost of care so my hat off to the chef. We ordered a side of asparagus which didn't come out with the ordered but our waitress quickly rectified once she came back maybe 10 mins later.  Overall this just an ok visit and maybe it's because the group was to big for our waitress but why make a reservation if Eddie's isn't going to put the best person on the reservation or at least 2 waiters. We didn't have any issues with billing but I did hear valet parking was a pain. We're regulars uptown for football so we parked in our normal free parking literally 2 mins from Eddie's. I'll definitely comeback for the oysters and Seabass. Not the 5 I was expecting but I did enjoy some of the food.

8PXzHsFD3rOULQeEHkvJYw.text: Went on a Sunday during restaurant week with a group. It was very busy and it took awhile for us to get seated but the wait was worth it. Although we didn't request a private room, we had one AND we had a tv with an awesome server! If you ever go, see if you can get LA.   While I loved the vibe of the restaurant, I was a little disappointed with the food. Granted, the items I ordered were from the restaurant week menu so they may not have been up to par. I ordered the salad, salmon with veggies and banana foster butter cake. I love salmon, veggies and butter cake! But I didn't love them here. Nothing was bad, per session, but I have had better. The one thing that was delicious was the crab fried rice. I wish I would have ordered that!   I'd definitely go again because I loved the service and there were some other things I wanted to try but won't be trying what I had again.

EftVNRMvNAiHDVMzb_FyCw.text: Eddie V's was a standout in the Charlotte seafood scene. Our waiter was outstanding and very knowledgeable of all of the choices available to us.

E7r6YjcYCikMNx_yDwE1Vg.text: Been hearing all the hype about this place So me and my girlfriend wanted to give it a try. we got there and it was packed but we were seated relatively quick which that was good.  we ordered drinks and then after that waited about 7 to 8 minutes before even getting our first drink after that my girlfriend had to wait an additional 7 to 8 minutes for her wine so as a gentleman I didn't drink my beer because I wanted to wait for her.  My girlfriend had to remind the server about her wine so  he ran and got it. We ended up having to tell another server to take orders because our server disappeared for quite a while she was very nice. Our calamari  app came out and The flavor of the calamari was good maybe a little overcooked and I feel like it could use some of that sauce that comes with calamari at other restaurants otherwise no complaints. my Salad came out that was also good and then the entree came out.  we have been at the restaurant for about an hour and 20 minutes at this point into dinner when the entree came out.  My overall experience was not satisfying after spending $125 I would say that I won't recommend this to anybody if someone asked

-fvSEa-fuYfBqc-0GNQG8g.text: Great location, very beautiful inside. Great welcoming staff. I proposed during my dinner and Erin made sure everything was to my standard. Truffle Mac and cheese tastes really good. Asparagus was huge. Bacon wrapped filet with crab on top.

sddNlIUJdcZ6z6qyXV03PQ.text: I had a wonderful dinner at Eddie V's Saturday night.  It was the first time dining there but won't be the last.  The salad was really good, the steak was so tender and perfectly done but the flaming bananas foster was to die for!  Our servers Justin and LA were top notch and very helpful and informative.  The decor was beautiful and made for an overall fabulous dining experience.

2eXicOEkZwY0S9AKaDffsg.text: Eddie V's is now one of my favorite restaurants to visit while I'm in Charlotte. The decor makes for an awesome upscale feel for a great dinner. While eating a live jazz band was playing which really made it relaxed with an uptempo feel. I ordered the 6oz Filet with a side of mashed potatoes and it was delicious!!

cFL0sFd9reIoq2ctptSnmA.text: I love this place! The food is beyond amazing, the ambiance is so chic & the service!....Colton was my server & he was spot on! Very personable & proactive. When I return for my bday, I'm specifically asking for him! He made my first visit a success. Didn't meet the chef but I know my scallops were cooked to perfection. I rarely leave reviews but to not do so this time would be selfish, I had to share!

Qedu07mIrVnqHT5HopXKNQ.text: Amazing !!! I am so happy Charlotte finally has a Seafood restaurant to be proud of ! Walking in I automatically felt like I was in another city .  Cocktails were amazing !!! Food was delicious !!! My friend got the salmon which I felt was a good portion ; it was also very delicious. I had the scallops which were equally great . I was nervous about getting the scallops because at a previous restaurant I had a total of 3 scallops with my meal . The video I am uploading shows the size of the scallops . Two cons : my sever seemed not to knowledgeable about the wine and also never tried to up sell my table . My friend and I both worked in the service industry years ago so small details we noticed . We would have loved a desert but the server never mentioned anything ; instead he just brought the check .  I honestly felt the poor guy was nervous . The place is brand new so we were very understanding. I am so happy this is here in Charlotte ! We really needed and deserved this !!!

uR1xxd_HHwWtykg6NO1cOQ.text: What a meal!! My wife and I are spending a few days in Charlotte and stumbled upon Eddie V's. We are certainly glad we did! The professionalism of the staff was superb. The food was delicious and packed full of flavor and finesse. We started off with beautifully crafted cocktails, both delicious. Then had the shrimp cocktail with house-made dipping sauces. Be careful on the horseradish as it is amazingly powerful. Loved it though. My wife ordered the swordfish and throughly enjoyed it. I ordered the Parmesan Sole and couldn't be any happier with my choice. The roasted Brussel sprouts with shallots and bacon were a perfect addition to both meals. We finished with the Black berry cobbler with vanilla bean ice creme. Simply put, if you are wanting a fantastic meal with great service and attention to detail, Eddie V's will certainly deliver. Did I mention there was a live jazz band to accompany our meal?? Also, Marc was an exceptional waiter. I Would highly recommend him and this restaurant.

3kMQZdoP1B0m1Ih9m1vZ6w.text: Fantastic! Everything was absolutely delicious, service and atmosphere perfect and the cocktails were great too. It was our wedding anniversary and our waitress surprised us with the banana foster dessert (wow!) and 2 glasses of champagne. We've already made our next reservation for Charlotte restaurant week. If you park at the BofA garage, don't forget to get your parking ticket validated for 2 hours of free parking.

-p_kheBZc5hEwz-1s7bekQ.text: This new, upscale restaunt has beautiful decor and the food is high quality and delicious.  However,  they still have a few things to work out as it relates to service.  As an offshoot of The Capital Grill, I expected more than the Valet to tell me that if I wasn't done by midnight, I would have to walk to the B of A garage and pay an extra $22 for parking.  The wait staff wears very nice, butler style jackets, but they seemed inexperienced and not well trained.  The bar service was sub par as well.  Our bartender was not familiar with the menu and seemed timid and reluctant to engage as good bartenders do.  I hope this helps and I hope they get it together because I would like to add Eddie V's to my list of places to go.

GsD0rXJVd-C2Z3jiPxn3VQ.text: Definitely the best Bone-in Ribeye in town! After visiting with my colleagues, I decided to returned the very next evening just to share this experience with my fiance. Our hostess Andrea as well as our server Dominique were very pleasant. I made sure to request Dominique upon my return because of her attentiveness in serving our table. In addition to the Bone-in Ribeye, we enjoyed sauteed spinach, lobster mashed potato's, and the bananas foster. Great taste, and greater presentation!

3aJOGeWUdUtJMSVQsycA9g.text: Fantastic dinner experience tonight being served by Emily. She was very friendly, thoroughly explained their specialities and answered all of our questions. Her warm personality and smile made us feel very welcomed as it was our first time at Eddie V's. Not only did they have a birthday card on the table for us, but they also provided a complimentary champagne toast and a birthday dessert. This restaurant knows how to provide quality service and delicious food. We will definitely return!

l_MTyS93Mb8ftw8gOKhHyw.text: 1st visit tonight with husband: hostesses made you feel welcome, bartender (Mallory) was pleasant and made great drinks.  Once seated for dinner we had attentive and pleasant service from Christine.  The entertainment was a welcome treat and the restaurant decor and ambiance is elegant yet relaxed.  Our food was delicious, if you order the crab legs make it an appetizer as it is just that but good.  My husband had an issue with his entree but it was handled quickly with no issues.  The manager (Brynn) was very customer focused and made you feel appreciated for your visit.  We look forward to our next visit.

vjpJXTfEOHE_ckOiZSQX8w.text: Extremely disappointed. We came here for my wives birthday and were expecting a great meal. The waitress was very attentive and everyone was really nice. That was the positive. They were pushing South African Lobster tails which sounded perfect for a special meal. The waitress even said she would never go back to Maine Lobster after that. With that endorsement I needed to try it. Price wasn't a factor considering it was a Birthday meal, but that was the worst lobster I've ever had. The person who served it out it on the table and then poured a ton of this butter sauce on it. Thanks for asking us first. If you have to drown your lobster in butter then it probably isn't good lobster. We got the 2 tail special for $90 and ate a half of one tail. It was chewy and dry even with that sauce. We also ordered King Crab Legs, but they never made it to the table. Probably dodged a bullet on that one. We ordered the sole for the kids which was okay, but nothing special. Same with the calamari appetizer, I've had much better for cheaper. I really enjoy seafood and was looking forward to trying Eddie V's, but after not enjoying the food and then getting a $250 bill, I will never go back. There a much better options in Charlotte even for seafood.

-o66WGxJ8ZFr_mVcR55b4g.text: I was able to experience this restaurant during one of their Preview nights.  The restaurant is beautiful and is good for a romantic night out or large group.  Everything we ate was amazing and I highly recommended it!  Apps: Crabcake and Yellowtail sashimi - delicious!!! Entrees: We had the Parmesan Crusted Sole, the Halibut and NY Strip 16 oz medium rare cooked to perfection - All three were amazing and personally the Sole is probably the best-tasting fish dish I've had in all of Charlotte. Sides: Lobster Mashed potatoes & Asparagus - yummm!!! Dessert: Godiva chocolate molten cake, my husband almost melted in his chair and said this was the best chocolate cake he's ever tasted.

_ULB5H6YiecJe0Y9Ayu1wA.text: I'm a huge fan of Eddie V's Chicago so I was thrilled we were getting one here. EV Chicago's service is as top notch as it gets. The atmosphere is warm- almost like a speakeasy it's so dark & classic. We saved our first visit for a birthday celebration. Sadly, I'm extremely disappointed in the Charlotte location. Breaks my heart. We won't be back.   Quick summary for short attention spans: Good food, weird decor & atmosphere, dreadful service management.   The pros: The food was good. The s'mores dessert might be one of the best in town. Steak & tuna were cooked perfectly. ( Oddly- We were never offered cracked pepper with our salad or entrees despite it being offered at other tables. Our server couldn't be bothered, I guess. )  The cons: The atmosphere is very out of sync with the restaurant and brand. The lighted nightclub details at the entrance and glitter curtains are disorienting. It's a high end joint but the artwork is from early 2000 era TJ Max. All weird choices for such a great restaurant. I could get past the decor if it weren't for the service...  I would call the service terrible. Our servers were working as a pair with two large tables and us. We were clearly the lowest possible priority. We waited 10 minutes before we were greeted, another 10 for water, it was maybe a full thirty minutes before our drink & app order was taken. The entire time we waited a staff of 8, including a floor manager, were clearing tables around us. The manager could see we were just sitting there looking around for a server. The managers lack of action shows me it wasn't an off night and service would be similar any night. (By contrast, EV Chicago has so many people waiting on customers you almost have to tell them to back off.)   Our server clearly knew nothing past a few buzz words on wine and the menu. I'm not a food or wine snob but if you want me to spend $100+ on a bottle, you need know more than red with red meats. Right?  (At EV Chicago, the servers can speak to every bottle and really help you find what you should pair with your meal.)  All in all, Charlotte has enough unique and interesting high end spots for celebrations and special nights out. I would skip Eddie V's and go somewhere more authentic with genuine service. However, if you are ever in Chicago- go!

OS7eGbxHL6yzhZoaFYeTLw.text: We went for Thanksgiving dinner because family was scattered. We were told when I made the reservation that they had great menu and great music in the lounge. Musicians  didn't show. Turkey was horrible. Thick like the Processed ham you buy at the grocery store And super expensive. Eddies has great steaks and seafood but their holiday menu was beneath them So very disappointing

EWijX4Kq5eDFI7QbuRenEA.text: What a wonderful evening we had! 1st my husband had told them it was our anniversary so they had decorated our table with rose petals and a happy anniversary card. We had the calamari appetizer that was seasoned to perfection. There was bread  and salted butter that was delicious. The 24karat raspberry drink was great but my husband cant stop talking about their lemonade! The best lemonade he ever had. The bacon wrapped filet was exceptional and together with the crab on top was like a party in my mouth. David was our waiter and he was very attentive. We couldnt have asked for a better.

RdZK9o5usyG-NEr708KZCQ.text: This was my second time visiting this Eddie V's while traveling for business. This place will not disappoint. The service, food, atmosphere, everything is perfection. Best filet and snapper I have every had, hands down. I will definitely be going back!

zWt-QRhaVHXZQJRPMjOSFA.text: If you're planning on using the valet here...don't. Eddie V's needs to get a valet system that is on par with the quality of their restaurant (and menu pricing) ASAP or we won't be back.

4M1tb4BSt1EARH1N5_JRWA.text: My friend and I came here for a little catching up and we had a GREAT time! The food was good and the sauces that the restaurant used for their dishes were a perfect touch to them! We shared the filet mignon sliders, calamari and shrimp... and OH MY GOODNESS, heaven in my mouth. For their drinks, we had their house mojito and sangria and we were very pleased! I definitely plan on returning in the near future. Feel free to check out my pictures of our dishes and drinks!

unQ3nb9OLdDBJg12dlvYEQ.text: On Sunday January 27th my husband and I went to Eddie V's Prime Seafood to celebrate both of our birthdays.  It was the end of Restaurant Week, so they were very busy, even so we were seated within just a few minutes of our reservation time.  The ambience of the restaurant is exactly what you'd hope, the decor was sleek and beautiful and the wait staff was very pleasant and efficient.  Once seated, we quickly we had birthday cards on the table from the Eddie V's team, what a special touch!  My  husband and I shared a crab cake app and a bottle of champagne to start our night off.  Our server was very attentive to fill our glasses as needed!  The crab cake was flavorful and cooked perfectly.  For our next course my husband ordered the lobster bisque  and I had the cesar salad.   The soup and salad came out in just the right amount of time, not too quickly but not too long that we were there just waiting.  Both were delicious.  For our entrees we ordered the Stuffed Jumbo Shrimp and the Scallops and decided to share sides of spinach and brussel sprouts.  The portions were perfect!  The dishes all tasted as lovely as they looked!  Best Scallops I have ever had!  Our server was so sweet, when we finished our entrees she brought us special desserts for out birthdays.  At this point we were so full, but there is always a little room for dessert!  We will be back to Eddie V's!

FZT3M0twCOxYdACgTw7a-g.text: We had our New Year's Day dinner here. The hostess, waitress & everyone we're very kind to my 5 year old daughter and my elderly mom. The service was amazing!! My mom is a food critic because she cooks from scratch alot! My mom had the ribeye and after her 1st bite she said, "it's delicious!" My daughter loved her kids meal of 4 colossal grilled shrimp & fries!! We had the crab cake as an app & it was very meaty!! My Sea Bass was excellent with the perfect spice of fresh ginger & a light soy sauce with spinach. The lobster mashed potatoes with asparagus and hollandaise sauce was AMAZING!! Yolanda was our waitress & she was very patient, explained everything we asked about, attentive & personable. She didn't rush you to make a decision & that's superb service. Also, Yolanda asked in the very beginning, "do we have any time constraints?" I was blown away & my mom was extremely impressed with this considerate question! Oh!! The Banana Foster is amazing

AIUelhGLgEgPFADkeGt4Dg.text: Good professional staff and good food.  An added bonus is they validate valet parking.

nY8-v9VqEnhTIlhuLTTWlA.text: This restaurant is fantastic. We have been here three times. Each time we received awesome service and excellent food. I highly recommend the lobster tacos, truffle mac and cheese and bananas foster for dessert. My husband has gotten the scallops twice and each time they were great. Their cocktails are good too. Paired with live music each night and you have a great date night!

lRHu1zX0H2F8T5qgL50Tcw.text: First time here. Wonderful ambience. Upscale attire. Superb food. We tried the Kung Pao calamari which was delicious, a side sauce would have been nice. Everything we had was delicious: scallops, mashed potatoes, Brussel sprouts, filet mignon. My husband and I thoroughly enjoyed our date night without the kids. We'll be back.

6hURNSAdEAipE_B_8s51mA.text: My wife and I had dinner last night at Eddie V's and had a great experience. The staff was very accommodating in seating us before our reservation. The ambiance in the upstairs dining area was great. Most of all the service and food was outstanding. We enjoyed Bluepoint oysters, Ahi Tuna and Salmon. This was our first visit to this restaurant and would highly recommend it for any special occasion or after/before a theater performance.

d5iFz8pPLBa7OkPTna2Rfg.text: I've had this restaurant flagged on my list to visit for a while now.  Ended up Visiting during restaurant week with my bestie.  Loved the live jazz band and ambiance. Drinks and server were amazing.  The crab and corn chowder was delicious.  My steak was over cooked. The truffle mashed potatoes lacked flavor and were dry.  The fried rice was definitely a hit.  I wasn't a fan of any of the desert options for restaurant week options but my friend loved the banana fosters butter cake.  I'll definitely come back and try out some of the other offerings.

jSAcBLnBzqveUjbNcerrBw.text: Had a wonderful dinner from beginning to end... atmosphere was just perfect and both staff and manager did great job with wine choices and suggestions. The manager is practically a sommelier! I've had Chilean sea bass all over the world and this was by far the best I ever had. I think the soy ginger sauce did it and it was such a beautiful piece of fish to begin with! Also the Parmesan sole rocked!  Oysters Rockefeller were a bit disappointing: they don't put PERNOD in theirs which to me exemplifies a True OYSTERS ROCK. That one drop per oyster really makes a difference.  Great location too as it was next to our hotel which was the Omni. Walking across the street was nice after dinner with the waterfall on the town square.

xi9ViZ14TzOobl0KePiREw.text: I really wish my first time eating at this establishment was not during restaurant week. My salad was bland, and my steak was way undercooked and had to be returned for a new one. The banana fosters dessert had a VERY strong alcohol flavor, but was fun to look at. Maybe we will give this place another shot in the future.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States

hs1-qoZ-2QnEafW21k6YJA.text: Okay, yeah its pricey but its great food. The bread is always delicious and hot, the staff are terrific, the interior is amazing and they have live music nearly every night in the bar. The tuna tartare is simply an amazing burst of different flavor combinations, the lobster taco appetizer is large enough to be a meal. The Hong Kong Sea Bass is stellar and the truffle mac n cheese and crab rice sides are perfect. If you want a knock out dessert go for the incredible bananas foster butter cake. I am one bite dessert eater but I had many on this one.

S1faAzQoU7KSBuYhgXLS1g.text: If you want to be dis'd by a waitress this is your place; How can you be this ostentatious as a SERVER!! I expected some courtesy and friendly conversation but instead I received a cold shoulder and a long wait for something as simple as a glass of Pinot Noir., Really, how hard can it be?? Now on the other side I heard Jason Atkins here and he is fantastic; great piano player ands a great guy and entertainer; go for the music but take your flask and avoid the ostentatiousness of the staff; it matters if you are black or white, just saying

fQOIc7Sqg55OhUcaM-ZKCA.text: Great atmosphere, service and food.  The Restaurant was packed on Friday night but we lucked out and got a table by the wine room (technically bar seating), but it was very cozy and even a little romantic.  Our waitress, Gem, could not have been friendlier, more knowledgeable or attentive.  The manager was also working hard to make sure everyone was taken care of and enjoying their evening.  Live music also played in the bar area, it sounded great.  We ordered a tuna appetizer, crab cake and swordfish.  My wife is still raving about the crab cake.  The Brussel sprouts were very good and fairly unique.  Just an overall classy place.  There are two levels of seating and some tables are definitely more desirable but all are very nice.  If your looking for a fancy celebration restaurant, this is a great choice.  We'll be back.

FTX0priGGBx9ldht5aNIpw.text: Everything was amazing! The au gratin potatoes, the sea bass, crab shrimp, the calamari, the desert we got for our anniversary. THE SERVICE!! Emily was an absolute joy! Can't wait to go back next year!!

SWCDaOe_jTQ82dsMH9aNqQ.text: Best Steakhouse in the CHARLOTTE area. Filet was like butter that you barely needed a knife.  Calamari was excellent and the banana foster dessert was amazing. been there three times.  Service is great. Music on some nights. A bit pricey but excellent food. Highly recommend.

KeLIYZ41TwK5EuoxtfAIqA.text: I had an overall great experience but don't stop here. There is a manager that is awful and just bad at customer service. I believe her name is Amy, but I know she is blonde. My food was not great but the server and bartenders fixed the problem and the kitchen got it right. I would recommend this restaurant I loved my bartender and my server. Great staff outside of that one manager.

oUzv2v_c4R33fmoCwI1MUg.text: OK, I am a regular at the Capital Grille. This is a new place to Charlotte, it was Christmas Eve, so we figured we would give it a shot. Well, Peter ands Sherry you'd better hope they don't open Eddie's for lunch or I might sneak over. It's equidistant from my office. Made a reservation on Open Table. Things started out poorly. The ladies at the front desk redefined disorganization. Yes I had a reservation, they were running on time, but I should sit down for a drink at the bar. Grabbed a table IN THE BAR. Waiter came up with some bread. When we said we were just waiting for a table and would just like a drink, he dropped that bread like we said we had a bomb. Told us he would have someone help us. (Obviously below his pay grade) No one ever came. He was standing over to the side so he wasn't swamped, just not his job. It was by then past reservation time (remember they are running on time) so I walked over to the hostesses. You could see the "Uh oh I forgot" on their faces. We weren't in a hurry so I said ok. One hostess said she was going to bring us champagne. Never got any champagne. About 10 minutes later a guy came up and asked if we wanted a drink. Of course hostess came right then and said our table was ready. Really confusing frustrating start.  There is a Thai place in Vegas that has long waiting times. They have a system, take your number and message you on your cell when the table is ready. You can wander around while you wait. You have 10 minutes to get back from wherever you are when the text you. If they did that at Eddie's you could walk up to the Capital Grille where the front desk and bar are organized like Amazon Prime, have a drink and wait for your summons to Eddie's for a table. It's only a block away!  Things went straight up hill from there. Our waiter, I want to say Arron, was as smooth as they come. We had drinks, a little wine, salads and entrees. Service was impeccable, timing was right on and attention was just right, never intrusive. Our waiter was charming.  Goat cheese and arugula salad was the best EVER. Heirloom tomatoes looked good but my sister doesn't share. One rule was no meat as we were having beef on Christmas. My son had the sole, I had shrimp, my sister tuna. All were outstanding. Crab fried rice came out perfectly hot and without a shell, so someone at Eddies's is reading these reviews. Desserts looked outstanding but we were too full to try. Surprising, the check wasn't so terrible all things considered. A little help at the front desk and bar (maybe a lot) of help and open for lunch, this place would be pretty close to perfect. Just hold your temper until you get to your table.

GrCcM3sODwL_i9jsYhh7xw.text: Ok, so this spinoff of Capital Grille takes it to the next level. You must try the smoked old fashioned, one of the best I've had. Their kung pao calamari rivals the CG's with cherry peppers. The service has been outstanding. This ain't McCormick & Schmick. We had the Chilean sea bass and scallops which were life-changing. The bananas foster dessert is otherworldly. You must eat here.

UoF52jOVOzSHNL7XPrbjlw.text: My husband loves this place and would definitely come back for a special date night. I have a seafood allergy and mainly went for my husband to enjoy the food, but I was extremely delighted in the attention and care they put into ensuring I had a wonderful dinner to enjoy. The filet was perfect and we plan on bringing friends here in the future!

XilQccoHnss4A93Citzp7w.text: What a way to spend a Wednesday evening after work!! Our first choice changed, so we tried Eddie Vs and I am so glad we did. The bartender, Patrick, was amazing. Not only did he make an amazing drink but delivered impeccable service. Each EV teammate was amazing!! The icing on the cake was the live band.....just so mellow, classic and absolutely drove the ambience in the bar space.   I WILL be back...again and again!!

COdkAuTw04cN0LpjHtHr3g.text: Decent atmosphere. Great food.  We had a big group of 14 under a reservation- but all went smoothly.

m2HkokpOoOkm9ba6NTtFTQ.text: Food is above mediocre service terrible sat at bar and bartender spent most of her time hanging out with friend waited long time to order for everything just due to having to interrupt server the other person behind bar was trying so hard to cover his co worker but I personally will never go back. I stay 12 times a year and always entertain BLT and CAPITAL much better service

cyKjqUn9UHJGaMgAcAjxgw.text: I had previously been to the Eddie V's in Orlando and found the food to be better.   Let's start with the pros Beautiful atmosphere Amazing service  The food is not what you would expect for the price. The calamari was delicious.   My sea bass was good, but nothing to rave about and lacked flavor. The presentation was neat though.   My husband's filet was good, but once again nothing to get excited about and we have both had much better filets with more flavor in Charlotte.   The brussel sprouts were awful. They were more steamed and not much flavor to them. We were expecting more of a roasted flavorful dish, but they tasted like steam in a bag, texture and all.  It's a beautiful spot, but wouldn't not be a top choice again when we are looking for a meal at this price point.

QdfLmhnAlEzyjQQqEEyeAA.text: Had a great time! Initially went for happy hour and the planned to stay and check out the band. Little did I know of the great, attentive and professional service that awaited me; and not to mention the fantastic food. We started off with Cosmos for drinks and the lamb lollipops for appetizer; nice. Proceeded with dozen of mixed oysters ( eat and west coast, west coast was the site winner). The lobster bisque was to die for and the Fuji apple salad; well what can I say other than superb. Finished off with George's Bank Scallops and the Swordfish steak; wonderful. Oh yeah and the dessert, Hot chocolate Godiva cake; decadent scrumptious and sinful....yummy......oh yeah the band was on par.

jdW7EVM3uglbrGqZG04qkw.text: This is a very elegant, very clean, as well as very smooth place. The service is awesome. Nice ambiance.

zFB8FdDbwfhI5fhzzBCoOg.text: Ive been to all of the steakhouses in town and typically order a martini- since of course steakhouses are known for making a great dirty martini. Well Eddie V's didn't disappoint. It's probably the best place in town to get a dirty martini and oysters on the half shell.

uSMuzEuJpNJ3Mpl4Oxc1oQ.text: I love this steak house. Disclosure: I am a Ruth Chris gal..loyal and devoted Ruth Chris frequenter...but Eddie V's!! I haven't been back to Ruth's since Eddie's came to charlotte a few months ago. The ambience is impeccable. The steaks are delightful. The bone in ribeye is huge, juicy, and tender. But the star of the show for me is the Oscar filet wrapped in bacon! Freaking amazing. Also the drinks are delish. The hope diamond is my fav. The moet and vueve clicquot flight are delish. The deserts are delightful; flourless chocolate cake and Banana foster yum! All in all one of the best dining experiences I have had in Charlotte.

photos.caption: Photo of Eddie V's Prime Seafood - Charlotte, NC, United States

STArPbzm--294XDn52yLHw.text: This place is top notch.  The decor alone is worth coming for.  This place looks like they just hosted the royal wedding.  Four of us can for a birthday at 7:30 on a Sunday, and the place was maybe 30% full.   The crab cake was fantastic.  The Caesar flavor was really good, and the presentation was fantastic.  I had the halibut, which was cooked perfectly, and tasted good, but I didn't think the sauce was up to par.  A little watery and chili didn't seemed to have been cooked long enough.  The hardest part to write about this review is the service.  Either our waitress was having a rough evening, or she just doesn't have a lot of personality.  She made a couple errors that weren't a big deal, but because of the dullness they seemed to be more annoying.  At this price and level of restaurant, the service is usually a lot higher of a level.    I'd definitely come back again.
